definition.en: (engineering/medicine) to place excessive physical stress on a material or body part, increasing the risk of damage
definition.zh: （工程/医学）使材料或身体部位承受过大应力，增加损坏或受伤风险

examples.en: Overstressing the metal can cause cracks over time.
examples.zh: 让金属承受过大应力，久而久之可能产生裂纹。

examples.en: Overstressing the wrist may lead to tendon pain.
examples.zh: 手腕过度受力可能导致肌腱疼痛。

extraExplanation: “stress”在英语里常见有两类意思：①心理上的压力/焦虑（stress about work）；②物理上的受力/应力（stress on a joint / stress a material）。因此“overstressing”既可指“太焦虑/太强调”，也可指“过度受力”。
形式上，“overstressing”常见于进行时或动名词结构：You are overstressing… / Overstressing can cause…；其原形动词是“overstress”。

summary.en: Overstretch means to stretch too far or to push beyond practical limits (often time, money, or energy).
summary.zh: Overstretch 指“拉得过度”或“超出可承受的限度”（常指时间、金钱或精力）。

definition.en: to stretch something too far, so it becomes strained, damaged, or pulled too tight
definition.zh: 把某物拉得过度，导致绷紧、拉伤或损坏

examples.en: Be careful not to overstretch the rubber band, or it will snap.
examples.zh: 小心别把橡皮筋拉得太过，不然会断。

examples.en: He overstretched the muscle during warm-up and had to stop training.
examples.zh: 他热身时肌肉拉伤了，只好停止训练。

definition.en: to try to do too much or go beyond your limits (time, money, energy, ability)
definition.zh: 做得太多或超出自己的极限（时间、金钱、精力、能力等）

examples.en: Don’t overstretch yourself—take a break if you’re exhausted.
examples.zh: 别把自己逼得太紧——累了就休息一下。

examples.en: The company overstretched its budget and had to cut costs later.
examples.zh: 公司预算超支，后来不得不削减开支。

examples.en: She overstretched her schedule by saying yes to too many projects.
examples.zh: 她答应了太多项目，把日程排得过满。

definition.en: an instance of stretching too far or pushing beyond limits
definition.zh: 过度拉伸或过度勉强的一次情况

examples.en: Trying to travel to three cities in one weekend was an overstretch.
examples.zh: 一个周末去三个城市实在太勉强了。

extraExplanation: “overstretch”既可用于身体上的“拉伤/拉过头”，也很常用于比喻：把时间、预算或精力“撑得太满”。在工作语境里常见搭配是 “overstretch yourself”（别把自己逼太紧）以及 “overstretch the budget/resources”（预算/资源超支）。

summary.en: Overstretched means stretched too far physically, or having too many demands and not enough resources.
summary.zh: Overstretched 指“拉伸过度（物理）”，也指“事情太多、资源不足而不堪重负（引申）”。

definition.en: Pulled or stretched too much, so it becomes tight, strained, or out of shape.
definition.zh: 被拉得过度的；拉伸过头的，因此变得很紧、吃力或变形的。

examples.en: The rubber band snapped because it was overstretched.
examples.zh: 橡皮筋因为被拉得太紧而断了。

examples.en: After the move, the old sofa covers looked overstretched at the corners.
examples.zh: 搬家后，旧沙发套在角落处看起来被撑得过紧。

definition.en: Having too many demands (time, money, energy, staff) and not enough resources; overworked or underfunded.
definition.zh: （时间/金钱/精力/人手等）被过度占用的；不堪重负的；资源不足的。

examples.en: Many teachers feel overstretched during exam season.
examples.zh: 考试季时，很多老师都觉得力不从心。

examples.en: The clinic is overstretched and can’t see new patients this week.
examples.zh: 诊所人手紧张，今天这周无法接收新病人。

examples.en: I’m overstretched financially right now, so I can’t travel.
examples.zh: 我现在经济很紧张，所以不能旅行。

extraExplanation: “Overstretched”由 over-（过度）+ stretched（被拉伸的）构成。字面意思是“拉过头”，引申到工作和生活语境里就表示“事情太多/资源不够”。
常见搭配：overstretched staff（人手紧张的员工队伍）、overstretched budget（捉襟见肘的预算）、overstretched schedule（排得过满的日程）、overstretched public services（不堪重负的公共服务）。
近义词区别：overworked 更强调“工作过度”；overburdened 更强调“负担过重”；understaffed 更强调“人手不足”；overstretched 更综合，既可指“被拉得太紧”，也可指“资源被用到极限”。

summary.en: “Overstretches” means stretches too much or pushes resources/yourself too far.
summary.zh: “overstretches”指拉伸过度，或（资源/自己）用力过猛、透支过度。

definition.en: to stretch something too far or too much, so it becomes tight, weak, damaged, or painful
definition.zh: 把某物拉得过长/过度，导致紧绷、变弱、受损或疼痛

examples.en: He overstretches his hamstrings before running and ends up sore.
examples.zh: 他跑步前把腿后腱拉得过度，结果酸痛。

examples.en: If the fabric overstretches, it may lose its shape.
examples.zh: 如果布料被拉得过度，可能会变形。

definition.en: to use more time, money, or energy than you really have; to push yourself or your resources too far
definition.zh: （时间、金钱、精力等）透支；把自己或资源逼得太紧、用得过头

examples.en: The team overstretches its budget by taking on too many projects at once.
examples.zh: 团队同时接太多项目，预算就被透支了。

examples.en: She overstretches herself trying to work full-time and study at night.
examples.zh: 她白天全职工作、晚上学习，把自己逼得太紧。

extraExplanation: “overstretches”通常是动词第三人称单数形式（He/She/It overstretches...），也可能是名词复数较少见的用法。更常见的词形还有：overstretch（原形）、overstretched（过去式/过去分词）、overstretching（进行时/动名词）。
在商业或经济语境里，overstretch常用来形容“扩张过度”（比如公司同时开太多店、接太多订单），带有“风险变大、可能撑不住”的含义。

summary.en: Overstretching means stretching or pushing beyond safe or reasonable limits, physically or in terms of time, energy, or resources.
summary.zh: overstretching 指（身体或材料）过度拉伸，或（精力、时间、资源）超出合理范围地硬撑、摊得太大。

definition.en: (present participle) Stretching something too far, beyond its safe or intended limit.
definition.zh: （现在分词）把某物拉得过度，超过安全或原本设计的限度。

examples.en: Be careful—you might damage the fabric by overstretching it.
examples.zh: 小心——把布料拉得太过可能会弄坏。

examples.en: Overstretching the rubber band can make it snap.
examples.zh: 把橡皮筋拉得过度会让它断掉。

definition.en: Trying to do more than you reasonably can; pushing your time, energy, or resources too hard.
definition.zh: （做事）勉强自己做得太多；把时间、精力或资源用得过头。

examples.en: She’s overstretching herself by working two jobs and studying at night.
examples.zh: 她白天打两份工、晚上还学习，实在把自己逼得太紧了。

examples.en: The team is overstretching its budget this year.
examples.zh: 这个团队今年的预算用得太紧了（有点撑不住）。

definition.en: The act or habit of stretching or pushing beyond limits (physical or figurative).
definition.zh: 过度拉伸；过度投入（指超出限度的行为或习惯，既可字面也可比喻）。

examples.en: Overstretching can lead to injury if you don’t warm up properly.
examples.zh: 如果不充分热身，过度拉伸可能会导致受伤。

examples.en: Overstretching of staff often causes burnout.
examples.zh: 让员工长期超负荷往往会造成职业倦怠。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、超过”。“overstretching”既可指身体/材料被拉得过度，也常用来比喻“精力、时间、预算、人手不够还硬撑”。
常见搭配：overstretch yourself（把自己逼得太紧）、overstretch the budget/resources（资源/预算透支）、avoid overstretching（避免过度拉伸/过度承担）。
和“overexerting（用力过猛）”相比，“overstretching”更强调“拉得太开/摊得太大”（无论是身体动作还是任务范围）。

summary.en: Overstrew means to scatter or spread things over a surface, often used in literary descriptions.
summary.zh: Overstrew 指把东西撒得到处都是、散布在表面上，常见于较文学化的描写。

definition.en: to scatter or spread things over a surface; to cover something by strewing items across it
definition.zh: 把（东西）撒得到处都是；把……散布在表面上；用撒落的东西覆盖

examples.en: Autumn had overstrewed the path with red and gold leaves.
examples.zh: 秋天把小路上撒满了红黄相间的落叶。

examples.en: The storm overstrewed the beach with driftwood and seaweed.
examples.zh: 暴风雨把海滩上散落得到处都是浮木和海藻。

examples.en: She overstrewed the table with flower petals for the ceremony.
examples.zh: 为了仪式，她把花瓣撒满了桌面。

extraExplanation: “overstrew”带有比较文学化、偏古典的语气，比常见的“scatter / strew”更强调“撒得到处都是、覆盖其上”的画面感，因此常用于描写自然景象（落叶、花瓣、雪、碎石等）。
动词“strew”（撒、散落）本身较少见；“over-”在这里有“在……之上、遍布”的意思。过去分词常见写法为“overstrewn”（也有规则变化“overstrewed”）。

summary.en: Overstrewed means “scattered over and covering a surface,” the past form of overstrew (literary).
summary.zh: overstrewed 指“撒得到处都是、遍布并覆盖表面”，是 overstrew 的过去式/过去分词（较文学用法）。

definition.en: Past tense and past participle of overstrew: to scatter or spread things over a surface so that it becomes covered.
definition.zh: overstrew 的过去式/过去分词：把东西撒得到处都是，使表面被散落物覆盖。

examples.en: The floor was overstrewed with books and papers after the move.
examples.zh: 搬家后，地板上满是散落的书和纸。

examples.en: In the poem, the garden is overstrewed with fallen petals.
examples.zh: 在诗中，花园里落英缤纷，花瓣撒满一地。

definition.en: Describing something as being scattered over a place (literary/old-fashioned).
definition.zh: 形容某处布满、散落着（文学或较古旧的用法）。

examples.en: A meadow overstrewed with wildflowers stretched to the river.
examples.zh: 一片布满野花的草地一直延伸到河边。

extraExplanation: overstrew 是较文学、较少见的词，常用于描写性文字（如诗歌、小说）来营造“满地/遍布”的画面感。
它的另一个常见过去分词形式是 overstrewn（更常见于现代英语）。两者意思相同：overstrew–overstrewed/overstrewn。
构词上可理解为 over-（遍及、覆盖）+ strew（撒、散布）。

summary.en: “Overstrewing” means scattering or spreading things over a surface (present participle of “overstrew”).
summary.zh: “overstrewing”表示把东西撒在某物表面、使其遍布（为“overstrew”的现在分词）。

definition.en: present participle of “overstrew”: scattering or spreading things over a surface; covering something by strewing.
definition.zh: “overstrew”的现在分词：把东西撒在某物表面上；用“撒落/散布”的方式覆盖。

examples.en: In spring, the path was overstrewing with petals after the storm.
examples.zh: 春天暴风雨过后，小路上满是被撒落的花瓣。

examples.en: She walked through the hall, overstrewing the floor with confetti.
examples.zh: 她穿过大厅，把彩纸屑撒得满地都是。

examples.en: The gardener spent the morning overstrewing the beds with compost.
examples.zh: 园丁一早都在往花坛上撒堆肥。

extraExplanation: “overstrew/overstrewing”比较偏书面或文学用语，比常见的“scatter/spread/cover”更有画面感，常用来描写花瓣、落叶、雪、星光等“铺陈在表面”的意象。
相关词形：overstrew（原形），overstrews（第三人称单数），overstrewing（现在分词），overstrewn（过去分词，常见搭配：be overstrewn with… 表示“满是/遍布着……”）。

summary.en: Overstrewn means “scattered all over” or “covered with things spread around.”
summary.zh: overstrewn 表示“遍布、散落得到处都是；被散落之物覆盖”。

definition.en: Covered or scattered over a surface; strewn all over.
definition.zh: （表面上）遍布、散落着；撒得到处都是。

examples.en: The path was overstrewn with fallen leaves after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，小路上落叶遍地。

examples.en: Her desk was overstrewn with notes and open books.
examples.zh: 她的书桌上到处都是笔记和摊开的书。

definition.en: Past participle of “overstrew” (to strew or scatter over something).
definition.zh: “overstrew”的过去分词（指把某物撒在……上、使……布满散落之物）。

examples.en: The floor was overstrewn with toys.
examples.zh: 地板上到处散落着玩具。

extraExplanation: “overstrewn”来自动词“overstrew”（over- 表“在……之上/遍及” + strew 表“撒、散落”）。在现代英语中更常见的是结构“be strewn with … / be scattered with …”，而“overstrewn”更偏书面或文学描写，用来营造画面感。

summary.en: Overstricken is a rare, old-fashioned word meaning deeply shocked or overwhelmed; it can also mean “overstruck/overprinted” in a technical sense.
summary.zh: Overstricken 是少见的古旧用法，常指被震惊或压倒性情绪所淹没；技术语境下也可指“叠印/再次敲击”。

definition.en: (archaic/literary) Struck or affected very strongly (often emotionally), so that you feel shocked, overwhelmed, or unable to act for a moment.
definition.zh: （古体/文学用语）被强烈地“击中”或影响（常指情绪上），以至于一时震惊、不知所措或难以行动。

examples.en: She stood silent, overstricken with grief.
examples.zh: 她沉默地站着，悲痛得说不出话来。

examples.en: He seemed overstricken by the sudden news.
examples.zh: 突如其来的消息让他仿佛一时被震住了。

definition.en: (past participle of overstrike; rare) Hit or stamped again; in printing/typing, characters printed on top of others.
definition.zh: （overstrike 的过去分词；少见）再次敲击/压印；在印刷或打字中，字符叠印在其他字符上。

examples.en: The label was overstricken, making the numbers hard to read.
examples.zh: 标签被叠印了，数字变得很难辨认。

extraExplanation: “overstricken”多见于较老的文学作品，表示“被震住/被打击得发懵”。现代英语更常用的同义表达有 “overwhelmed”, “stunned”, “shocked”。
它与 “overstruck”关系类似于 “stricken/struck”：两者都可作过去分词，但 “overstricken”更偏古旧、带文学色彩。

summary.en: Overstrict means ‘too strict’—more harsh or rigid than is reasonable.
summary.zh: overstrict 表示“过于严格”，即比合理程度更苛刻或更死板。

definition.en: Too strict; enforcing rules or standards more harshly than is reasonable or helpful.
definition.zh: 过于严格的；执行规则或标准时比合理或有帮助的程度更严厉。

examples.en: Some parents worry that being overstrict can damage trust with their teenagers.
examples.zh: 一些父母担心过于严格会破坏与青少年之间的信任。

examples.en: The new attendance policy feels overstrict, especially for students with medical appointments.
examples.zh: 新的出勤规定显得过于严格，尤其对有就医预约的学生来说。

definition.en: To make something too strict, or to enforce rules in an excessively strict way (less common).
definition.zh: 使（某事）过于严格；以过度严格的方式执行规则（较不常见）。

examples.en: If we overstrict the guidelines, the process will slow down and frustrate everyone.
examples.zh: 如果我们把指南定得过于严格，流程会变慢并让大家都感到挫败。

extraExplanation: “overstrict”在实际英语中不算常用；更自然的表达常见为“too strict”“overly strict”，或用名词短语“excessively strict rules/standards”。
拼写上有时也会看到带连字符的形式“over-strict”，意思相同；是否加连字符多取决于写作风格与排版规范。

summary.en: “Overstrictly” means “too strictly,” in a way that is overly rigid or unreasonable.
summary.zh: “overstrictly”表示“过于严格地”，强调严格得过头、过分死板。

definition.en: In a way that is too strict or rigid; more strictly than is reasonable or helpful.
definition.zh: 过于严格地；过分死板地（严格到不合理或无益的程度）。

examples.en: If you interpret the rule overstrictly, you may punish people who made an honest mistake.
examples.zh: 如果你过于严格地解读这条规定，可能会惩罚那些只是无心犯错的人。

examples.en: The teacher didn’t grade overstrictly; she considered effort and improvement.
examples.zh: 老师并没有过分严格地评分；她会考虑努力程度和进步。

examples.en: Overstrictly controlling what kids eat can sometimes create more anxiety around food.
examples.zh: 过分严格地控制孩子吃什么，有时反而会让他们对食物更焦虑。

extraExplanation: “overstrictly”由前缀 over-（“过度、过分”）+ strictly（“严格地”）构成，强调“严格到超过合理限度”。
这个词在日常口语中不算高频；更常见的表达是 “too strictly” 或 “overly strictly”。写作时如果想更自然，可以优先用这些替换。

summary.en: Overstrictness means being excessively strict—stricter than necessary or reasonable.
summary.zh: overstrictness 指“过度严格”，强调比必要或合理程度更严苛。

definition.en: Excessive strictness; being stricter than necessary or reasonable, often in rules, discipline, or interpretation.
definition.zh: 过度严格；过分严苛（常指规则、纪律或解释过于苛刻、超过必要程度）。

examples.en: The teacher’s overstrictness made students afraid to ask questions.
examples.zh: 老师的过度严格让学生不敢提问。

examples.en: Some critics say the policy’s overstrictness discourages people from applying.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为该政策过于严苛，反而让人不敢申请。

examples.en: We need standards, but overstrictness can hurt trust and creativity.
examples.zh: 我们需要标准，但过度严格会伤害信任和创造力。

extraExplanation: 这个词由 over-（“过度”）+ strictness（“严格”）构成，语气通常带批评，强调“严过头了”。在正式写作中也可用更常见的表达：excessive strictness / undue strictness / being too strict。

summary.en: “Overstridden” means having stepped too far or gone beyond proper limits; it’s the past participle of “overstride” and is somewhat literary/rare today.
summary.zh: “overstridden”表示迈得太远或超出适当界限，是“overstride”的过去分词，现代用法偏文学且较少见。

definition.en: Past participle of “overstride”: to step too far or too widely; to go beyond a proper limit (literal or figurative).
definition.zh: “overstride”的过去分词：迈步过大、跨得太远；（字面或比喻）超出适当的界限。

examples.en: By the end of the hike, he had overstridden his strength and had to rest.
examples.zh: 徒步快结束时，他已经透支了体力，只好休息。

examples.en: The company overstridden its budget, and the project was delayed.
examples.zh: 公司超出了预算，项目因此延期。

definition.en: (Less common) Describing someone or something as having gone too far beyond what is reasonable; overreaching.
definition.zh: （较少见）形容（某人/某事）做得过头、越界；过度伸张（类似 overreaching）。

examples.en: His overstridden ambition cost him allies.
examples.zh: 他过度膨胀的野心让他失去了盟友。

extraExplanation: “overstridden”在现代英语里比较少见，多见于较文学或较旧的书面语。日常表达更常用：overstepped（越界/做得太过）、went too far（做过头）、overreached（用力过猛/野心过大）。
词形提示：overstride（原形）→ overstrode（过去式）→ overstridden（过去分词），结构类似：stride → strode → stridden。

summary.en: Overstride means stepping too far/too long, or (figuratively) going beyond proper limits.
summary.zh: Overstride 指一步迈得过大/过远，或（比喻）做事越界、超出限度。

definition.en: to take a step or stride that is too long or too far; to step beyond a line or limit
definition.zh: 迈得过大或过远；跨过某条线或界限

examples.en: On the steep trail, I overstrode and nearly lost my balance.
examples.zh: 在陡峭的小路上，我一步迈得太大，差点失去平衡。

examples.en: Be careful not to overstride the painted line.
examples.zh: 小心别跨过那条画出的线。

definition.en: (figurative) to go beyond what is acceptable, safe, or reasonable; to overreach
definition.zh: （比喻）越过可接受、安全或合理的范围；过度行事

examples.en: The company overstrode its budget and had to cut costs later.
examples.zh: 公司超出了预算，后来不得不削减开支。

examples.en: He overstrode the limits of his authority by making decisions alone.
examples.zh: 他擅自做决定，越权了。

extraExplanation: “overstride”在现代英语中不算常用，更常见的说法是：字面义用“take too long a stride / overstep”，比喻义用“overstep / overreach”。
这个词常出现在较正式或文学化的表达里，搭配常见如“overstride the bounds/limits（越界）”。

summary.en: Overstridence (rare) means an excessively harsh, loud, or aggressively forceful tone or sound.
summary.zh: overstridence（罕见）指过度刺耳、过于强硬或咄咄逼人的语气/声音。

definition.en: (Rare/nonstandard) Excessive stridence: an overly loud, harsh, or aggressively forceful sound or tone (often referring to a voice, argument, or style).
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）过度刺耳：指声音、语气或表达方式过分响亮、尖锐或咄咄逼人（常用于形容说话、论辩或文风）。

examples.en: Some readers disliked the overstridence of the narrator’s voice, even when the point was reasonable.
examples.zh: 有些读者不喜欢叙述者语气的过度尖刻，即使观点本身是合理的。

examples.en: The debate turned unproductive because of the overstridence on both sides.
examples.zh: 由于双方都过于咄咄逼人，这场辩论变得没有建设性。

extraExplanation:
“overstridence”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下会被认为是不规范或拼写不常见的构词。更自然的表达通常是：
- “stridency”（刺耳、尖刻的特质）
- “being overly strident”（过于尖刻/强硬）
- “an excessively strident tone”（过度强硬的语气）
如果你是在文章里看到它，也可能是作者为了风格而临时造词（强调“strident”的过度程度）。

summary.en: Overstridency means too much stridency—an overly harsh, loud, or shrill sound or tone.
summary.zh: overstridency 指“过度刺耳/尖厉”，即声音或语气过分尖锐、嘈杂。

definition.en: excessive stridency; an overly harsh, loud, or shrill quality in a sound, voice, style, or tone.
definition.zh: 过度刺耳（或尖厉）；指声音、嗓音、风格或语气过分尖锐、嘈杂、令人不适。

examples.en: Some listeners found the overstridency of the violin in that recording hard to enjoy.
examples.zh: 有些听众觉得那段录音里小提琴的过度刺耳让人很难享受。

examples.en: The editor asked the writer to reduce the overstridency of the argument and sound more measured.
examples.zh: 编辑要求作者减少论证语气的过度尖刻，语调更沉稳一些。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多用于批评性语境（评论音乐、嗓音或文字语气）。更常见的表达是用更自然的搭配，如：“excessive stridency / too strident / harshness / shrillness”。
构词上是 over-（过度）+ stridency（刺耳、尖厉），意思直观，但因为不常用，写作时可优先选更常见的说法以避免显得生硬。

summary.en: Overstrident means excessively loud/harsh or overly forceful and aggressive in tone or manner.
summary.zh: Overstrident 指声音或态度过分刺耳、强硬、咄咄逼人。

definition.en: too loud, harsh, or forcefully confident in sound or manner; excessively strident
definition.zh: （声音或态度）过于刺耳、强硬或咄咄逼人；过分尖锐

examples.en: His overstrident tone made the discussion feel like an argument.
examples.zh: 他过于强硬刺耳的语气让讨论听起来像在吵架。

examples.en: The ad’s overstrident music was hard to listen to.
examples.zh: 广告里过分刺耳的音乐让人很难听下去。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、过分”。“strident”常用来形容声音“尖锐刺耳”，也可形容表达方式“强硬、咄咄逼人”。“overstrident”不算特别常见，更常见的说法是“too strident / overly strident”。
语感上它通常带负面评价：不是单纯“声音大”，而是“大到让人不舒服”或“强硬到让人反感”。

summary.en: “Overstridently” means speaking or acting in a way that is too loud, harsh, or aggressively forceful.
summary.zh: “Overstridently”表示以过分刺耳、强硬或咄咄逼人的方式说话或做事。

definition.en: in an excessively loud, harsh, or aggressive way (especially in speech or tone)
definition.zh: 以过分刺耳、强硬或咄咄逼人的方式（尤指说话语气）

examples.en: He criticized the plan overstridently, so people stopped listening to his points.
examples.zh: 他用过分强硬的语气批评这个计划，结果大家反而不再听他的观点了。

examples.en: The message came across overstridently, even though the intention was to help.
examples.zh: 尽管本意是帮助，但这番话听起来过于尖锐强势。

extraExplanation: “overstridently”由 over-（过度）+ strident（刺耳的、强硬的）+ -ly（副词）构成，常用于写作或评论中，评价某人的语气“太冲、太硬”，带有负面含义。

summary.en: Overstridentness means being too strident—overly loud, harsh, or aggressively forceful in tone or expression.
summary.zh: Overstridentness 指“过于尖锐/刺耳或咄咄逼人的语气与表达方式”。

definition.en: the quality of being too strident (too loud, harsh, or forcefully expressed), especially in someone’s voice, tone, or style
definition.zh: （声音、语气或表达方式）过于刺耳、尖锐或咄咄逼人的特质

examples.en: Some readers complained about the article’s overstridentness, saying the tone felt more aggressive than persuasive.
examples.zh: 一些读者抱怨那篇文章语气过于咄咄逼人，觉得更像在攻击而不是在说服。

examples.en: In the meeting, her overstridentness made colleagues defensive instead of open to discussion.
examples.zh: 在会议上，她过于尖锐的表达让同事变得防备，而不是愿意讨论。

examples.en: The director reduced the overstridentness of the dialogue so the characters sounded more human.
examples.zh: 导演削弱了台词中过于刺耳的感觉，让角色听起来更真实。

extraExplanation: “overstridentness”不是特别常见的固定词汇，更像是把 over-（过度）+ strident（刺耳/尖锐的）+ -ness（名词后缀）组合起来的“造词”，意思很直观：‘过度的尖锐/刺耳/强硬’。在写作中更常用的表达是 “excessive stridency” 或 “an overly strident tone”。

summary.en: Overstriding means taking steps that are too long, or (figuratively) going beyond proper limits.
summary.zh: overstriding 指步子迈得过大；也可比喻“越界、做得太过”。

definition.en: walking or stepping too far with each step; striding beyond a normal or safe distance
definition.zh: （走路/跑步时）步子迈得过大；每一步跨得超过正常或安全的距离

examples.en: He was overstriding on the downhill path and nearly lost his balance.
examples.zh: 他在下坡路上步子迈得太大，差点失去平衡。

examples.en: Try not to be overstriding—shorter steps will protect your knees.
examples.zh: 尽量别迈步过大——步子小一点能保护膝盖。

definition.en: the act of taking overly long steps; striding beyond what is appropriate
definition.zh: 迈步过大；跨步超过合适范围的行为

examples.en: Overstriding can cause shin pain for new runners.
examples.zh: 对新手跑者来说，迈步过大可能导致小腿胫骨疼痛。

definition.en: present participle of overstride: to take steps that are too long; to overstep (a limit) in a figurative sense
definition.zh: overstride 的现在分词：迈步过大；（比喻）越界、逾越界限

examples.en: In his ambition, he kept overstriding the limits of what his team could handle.
examples.zh: 在野心驱使下，他不断逾越团队所能承受的限度。

examples.en: She apologized for overstriding and speaking for others.
examples.zh: 她为自己越界、替别人发言而道歉。

extraExplanation: “overstriding”在运动语境里很常见，尤其是跑步：通常指脚落地点在身体重心前太远（步幅过大），容易增加膝盖或小腿负担。
在文学或较正式的写作中，它也常被用作比喻，表示“跨过界限/做得太过”，语气比普通的“go too far”更形象。

summary.en: Overstrike means typing/printing over existing text (or the mode that does this); less commonly, it means to strike hard.
summary.zh: overstrike 指在已有文字上覆盖重打（或指覆盖输入模式）；较少见时也可指猛击。

definition.en: to type or print characters on top of existing characters (often to correct text or to make a strike-through)
definition.zh: （在已有字符上）重打/覆盖打印（常用于更正文字或做删除线）

examples.en: In overstrike mode, the cursor replaces the letter instead of inserting a new one.
examples.zh: 在覆盖（overstrike）模式下，光标会替换字母，而不是插入新字母。

examples.en: She overstruck the mistake to make it look like a dash.
examples.zh: 她在错误处覆盖重打，让它看起来像一条短横线。

definition.en: to strike or hit with force (less common)
definition.zh: 猛击；重击（较少见）

examples.en: The soldier overstruck his opponent with the butt of the rifle.
examples.zh: 士兵用步枪托猛击对手。

definition.en: a setting or function in typing/editing where new text replaces existing text (opposite of insert mode)
definition.zh: 覆盖输入/改写模式（与插入模式相对）

examples.en: I accidentally turned on overstrike and deleted half my sentence.
examples.zh: 我不小心打开了覆盖模式，把半句都替换掉了。

extraExplanation: 在早期打字机和一些老式终端里，常见两种输入方式：insert（插入）和 overstrike/overwrite（覆盖/改写）。开启 overstrike 时，新输入的字符会“压在”原字符的位置上，因此容易不小心把原来的字替换掉。
在文字排版里，overstrike 也可指通过“在同一位置再次打印”来做效果（例如用下划线或短横线与原字重叠，形成类似删除线的效果）。

summary.en: Overstrikes are repeated strikes or overprinted marks, especially in typing/printing, or the act of striking again/too hard.
summary.zh: Overstrikes 指重复敲击或套打形成的痕迹（多见于打字/排版），也可指再次敲打或用力过猛地敲打这一动作。

definition.en: (plural form of **overstrike**) to strike something again, or to strike with too much force.
definition.zh: （**overstrike** 的复数/第三人称形式）再次敲击；或用力过猛地敲打。

examples.en: Be careful with the keyboard—you keep overstrikes on the same key.
examples.zh: 按键盘小心点——你老是在同一个键上重复敲击。

examples.en: The worker overstrikes the nail and bends it.
examples.zh: 工人钉钉子时用力过猛，把钉子敲弯了。

definition.en: (plural noun) extra strikes or printed marks made on top of existing text or symbols.
definition.zh: （复数名词）覆盖在原有文字/符号上的重复敲击痕迹；套打出来的多余印记。

examples.en: The scanned page shows several overstrikes where the typist made corrections.
examples.zh: 扫描页上能看到好几处套打痕迹，是打字员改错留下的。

examples.en: Remove overstrikes in the document before you submit it.
examples.zh: 提交前把文档里的套打痕迹清理掉。

extraExplanation: “overstrike”常见于打字机/早期终端与排版语境：同一位置再次“击打”字符，用来做简单的“加粗”（例如在同一字母上多打一次）或用“X”盖掉错误字符。某些终端还有“overstrike mode（覆盖输入模式）”，新字符会直接打在旧字符上方。

summary.en: Overstriking means striking again or striking on top of an existing mark, especially in coin-making or printing.
summary.zh: Overstriking 指再次敲打或在已有痕迹上覆盖式敲打，常用于硬币再铸或印刷/打字重打。

definition.en: the act or process of striking something again or striking on top of an existing mark (especially a coin or a printed character).
definition.zh: 再次敲打或在原有痕迹之上敲打的行为或过程（尤其指硬币再铸/压印，或在印刷字符上重打）。

examples.en: The museum displayed a coin made by overstriking an older coin with a new design.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了一枚通过在旧币上再铸压印新图案制成的硬币。

examples.en: In the old print shop, overstriking sometimes made the letters look darker and messy.
examples.zh: 在老式印刷坊里，重打有时会让字母看起来更黑、更乱。

definition.en: done by striking again or on top of something already struck/printed.
definition.zh: 通过再次敲打或覆盖式敲打（或重印）完成的。

examples.en: Collectors noticed overstriking marks along the edge of the coin.
examples.zh: 收藏者注意到硬币边缘有再铸压印的痕迹。

examples.en: The report mentioned an overstriking error on the document.
examples.zh: 报告提到文件上有重打造成的错误。

extraExplanation: “overstriking”常见于钱币学（numismatics）：指用新的模具在旧币坯或旧币上再压一次，把新图案“盖”在旧图案上。有时是为了节省金属或更换政权标志，因此旧图案可能仍隐约可见。
在打字机/印刷语境里，overstrike 指在同一位置再次击打字符（例如回车到同一格再打），可能用于加粗效果，但也容易产生重影或“脏字”。

summary.en: Overstring can mean stringing an instrument too tightly/heavily, or (for pianos) using a cross-string design.
summary.zh: overstring 可指给乐器上弦过紧/过重；也可指（钢琴）采用交叉上弦的结构设计。

definition.en: to put strings on (an instrument) too tightly or with strings that are too heavy, causing strain or poor sound
definition.zh: （给乐器）上弦过紧或使用过粗/过重的弦，导致张力过大或音色变差

examples.en: The guitar was overstrung, so the neck started to bend.
examples.zh: 这把吉他上弦过紧，所以琴颈开始弯曲。

examples.en: If you overstring a violin, it may sound harsh and be harder to play.
examples.zh: 如果小提琴上弦过重，声音可能会更刺耳，也更难拉奏。

definition.en: (especially of a piano) to arrange the strings so that some cross over others (cross-string)
definition.zh: （尤指钢琴）采用交叉上弦/交叉弦设计，使部分琴弦跨越其他琴弦

examples.en: Many modern grands are overstrung to produce a fuller bass sound.
examples.zh: 许多现代三角钢琴采用交叉上弦，以获得更饱满的低音。

examples.en: The technician explained that this model is overstrung, which changes how the soundboard vibrates.
examples.zh: 调律师解释说这款钢琴是交叉上弦的，这会改变音板的振动方式。

extraExplanation: “overstring”在日常英语里很少见，更常见的相关名词是 overstringing（交叉上弦）或 cross-stringing。
钢琴语境中的“overstrung piano”通常是中性描述（一种结构设计），而“overstring an instrument”表示“上弦过度/过紧”则带有负面含义。

summary.en: Overstringing means stringing something too tightly (too much tension), often a racket or instrument.
summary.zh: Overstringing 指给球拍或乐器等拉线/上弦过紧（张力过大）。

definition.en: the act or result of putting strings on something too tightly or with too much tension (often about sports rackets or musical instruments), which can reduce performance or cause damage
definition.zh: （给球拍或乐器等）拉线/上弦过紧、张力过大；导致手感变差或损坏的“过度拉线/过度上弦”

examples.en: Overstringing a tennis racket can make it feel harsh and harder on your arm.
examples.zh: 网球拍拉线过紧可能会让手感变硬，也更伤手臂。

examples.en: The coach suspected overstringing because the strings kept breaking quickly.
examples.zh: 教练怀疑是拉线过紧，因为球线总是很快就断。

definition.en: stringing something with too much tension; to over-tighten the strings (used as a gerund/present participle)
definition.zh: 把（球拍/乐器等）拉得过紧；上弦过紧（作动名词/现在分词）

examples.en: He regretted overstringing the racket before the tournament.
examples.zh: 他后悔在比赛前把球拍拉线拉得太紧。

examples.en: Overstringing the guitar can put extra stress on the neck.
examples.zh: 吉他上弦过紧会给琴颈带来额外压力。

extraExplanation: “Over-”表示“过度、过分”。“String”在运动器材领域常指“给球拍穿线/拉线”，在乐器领域指“给乐器上弦”。因此 overstringing 多见于网球/羽毛球/壁球等球拍，以及吉他、小提琴等需要上弦的乐器语境。
在球拍中，张力过高常见影响包括：甜区变小、手感偏硬、控球可能更“死”、更容易断线，且可能增加手臂不适风险；在乐器中则可能导致音色/手感不理想，甚至对琴颈等部位造成压力。

summary.en: Overstrive means to try too hard, often in a way that backfires.
summary.zh: overstrive 指“过度努力/用力过猛”，常常适得其反。

definition.en: to try too hard or put in more effort than is helpful, often causing stress, mistakes, or burnout
definition.zh: 过度努力；用力过猛（常导致压力、失误或精疲力竭）

examples.en: If you overstrive for perfection, you may end up anxious and exhausted.
examples.zh: 如果你对完美过度努力，可能会变得焦虑又疲惫。

examples.en: He overstrived in training and injured his knee.
examples.zh: 他训练用力过猛，把膝盖弄伤了。

examples.en: Don’t overstrive—steady progress is usually more sustainable.
examples.zh: 别过度用力——稳步前进通常更可持续。

extraExplanation: “overstrive”在现代英语里比较少见，更常见的表达是“try too hard”“push yourself too hard”或“overdo it”。写作中也可能看到带连字符的形式“over-strive”。
语气上，它常用来提醒别人不要把目标定得过紧、过度追求完美，尤其在学习、工作、运动训练等情境。

summary.en: “Overstriven” means having tried too hard or put in excessive effort (a rare form related to “overstrive”).
summary.zh: “Overstriven”表示“用力过猛/过度努力”（与罕见动词 overstrive 相关）。

definition.en: (Past participle of the rare verb “overstrive”) to have tried too hard; to have put in excessive effort, often in a way that becomes unhealthy or counterproductive.
definition.zh: （罕见动词 overstrive 的过去分词）过度努力；用力过猛；往往导致不健康或适得其反的结果。

examples.en: I realized I had overstriven for perfection and forgotten to rest.
examples.zh: 我意识到自己为了完美而过度努力，反而忘了休息。

examples.en: Her overstriven schedule left her exhausted by midweek.
examples.zh: 她那种“用力过猛”的日程安排，让她到周中就筋疲力尽了。

definition.en: Used with auxiliary verbs to form perfect tenses of “overstrive” (rare).
definition.zh: 与助动词连用，构成 overstrive（罕见）的完成时态。

examples.en: He has overstriven to impress his boss, and it shows.
examples.zh: 他一直想给老板留下好印象而过度用力，这一点很明显。

extraExplanation: “Overstriven”很少见；英语里更常用的表达是 overworked（过劳）、tried too hard（太用力/太拼）、pushed myself too hard（把自己逼得太紧）、overreached（做过头/力有不逮）。
它是由 over-（过度）+ strive（努力、奋斗）构成，形式上模仿了不规则变化如 strive–strove–striven，因此会看到 “overstriven” 这种过去分词。

summary.en: Overstriving means trying too hard—often so hard that it feels forced or leads to stress or burnout.
summary.zh: overstriving 指“过度努力/用力过猛”，常暗示显得刻意，或导致压力与耗竭。

definition.en: Trying too hard to achieve something, often in a way that feels forced, anxious, or socially unnatural.
definition.zh: 过度努力；用力过猛（常带有刻意、焦虑或不自然的感觉）。

examples.en: His jokes felt like overstriving, so the conversation became awkward.
examples.zh: 他的笑话听起来像是在用力过猛，所以谈话变得尴尬。

examples.en: In interviews, avoid overstriving—be prepared, but don’t sound rehearsed.
examples.zh: 面试时要避免过度用力：要准备充分，但别说得像背稿。

examples.en: She relaxed once she stopped overstriving and spoke naturally.
examples.zh: 她不再用力过猛、自然表达后就放松了。

definition.en: Trying too hard to succeed or impress; pushing yourself beyond what is reasonable or natural.
definition.zh: 过度用力地追求成功或取悦他人；把自己逼得太紧（不太合理或不自然）。

examples.en: He was overstriving to prove himself at work and quickly burned out.
examples.zh: 他在工作中过度证明自己，很快就筋疲力尽了。

examples.en: If you’re overstriving for perfection, you may miss the joy of learning.
examples.zh: 如果你为了完美而过度用力，可能会错过学习的乐趣。

extraExplanation: “overstriving”来自 over-（过度）+ striving（努力奋斗）。在日常英语里更常见的是动词短语 “try too hard” 或名词 “overachievement / overexertion”，而 “overstriving”带一点书面或评论性的语气，常用来评价一种“用力过猛、显得不自然”的努力。
语感上，它常暗示：努力本身没错，但方式/程度不合适，导致尴尬、焦虑、社交不自然，或身心耗竭。可与 “overcompensate（过度补偿）”“strain（勉强/紧绷）”对比理解。

summary.en: “Overstrode” is the past tense of “overstride,” meaning either stepping across something or (literarily) exceeding limits.
summary.zh: “overstrode”是“overstride”的过去式，表示跨过某物，或（文学语境）越界、超出限度。

definition.en: Past tense of “overstride”: to step over or across something; to cross by taking a long step.
definition.zh: “overstride”的过去式：跨过、迈过（某物）；以大步跨越而通过。

examples.en: He overstrode the fallen branch without slowing down.
examples.zh: 他没有放慢脚步就跨过了倒下的树枝。

examples.en: The hiker overstrode a narrow stream in one step.
examples.zh: 那位徒步者一步就跨过了狭窄的小溪。

definition.en: (Figurative, often literary) To go beyond proper limits; to overstep.
definition.zh: （比喻义，常见于文学语境）越界；超越应有的限度。

examples.en: In his ambition, he overstrode the bounds of caution.
examples.zh: 在野心驱使下，他越过了谨慎的界限。

examples.en: The report argues the company overstrode its legal authority.
examples.zh: 报告认为这家公司越过了其法律权限。

extraExplanation: “overstrode”属于较偏文学/书面用法，日常口语中更常用“stepped over / crossed / overstepped”。
它来自动词“stride（大步走）”，与不规则变化类似：stride–strode–stridden；因此 overstride–overstrode–overstridden。

summary.en: Overstrong means excessively strong or intense, especially in taste, smell, drink, or effects.
summary.zh: Overstrong 指“过于强烈/太浓/太冲”，常形容味道、气味、酒或效果等强得过头。

definition.en: Too strong or too intense; stronger than is pleasant, safe, or appropriate (often used for flavors, smells, drinks, medicine, or effects).
definition.zh: 过于强烈的；强得不舒服、不安全或不合适（常用于味道、气味、酒、药效或影响）。

examples.en: This coffee is overstrong—I can’t taste anything else.
examples.zh: 这咖啡太浓了——我什么别的味道都尝不出来。

examples.en: The perfume is overstrong in a small room.
examples.zh: 在小房间里这香水味太冲了。

examples.en: The medicine felt overstrong and made her dizzy.
examples.zh: 这药效太猛，让她觉得头晕。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、超出适当程度”。因此 overstrong 通常带有负面语气，暗示“超过了舒服/合适的界限”。
日常口语里，人们也常用 too strong 来表达同样意思；overstrong 稍微更书面或更强调“过度”。

summary.en: “Overstrongly” means “too strongly/too forcefully,” often implying an excessive or unhelpful intensity.
summary.zh: “Overstrongly”表示“过于强烈/过于强硬地”，常含“过度、可能适得其反”的意思。

definition.en: In a way that is too strong, forceful, intense, or extreme (often so much that it becomes inappropriate or unhelpful).
definition.zh: 过于强烈地；过分用力地；过于极端地（常指强到不合适或产生反效果）。

examples.en: He argued his point overstrongly, so the discussion turned into a fight.
examples.zh: 他过于强硬地争辩自己的观点，结果讨论变成了争吵。

examples.en: Don’t press the button overstrongly—you might break it.
examples.zh: 别太用力按按钮——可能会按坏。

examples.en: The writer stated the conclusion overstrongly without enough evidence.
examples.zh: 作者在证据不足的情况下把结论说得过于绝对。

extraExplanation: “overstrongly”= over-（过度）+ strongly（强烈地）。常用于批评语气，表示“用力过猛/态度过激/表达过于绝对”。在日常口语里更常见的替换说法有“too strongly”“too forcefully”“overly strongly”。

summary.en: Overstrongness means excessive strength or intensity.
summary.zh: overstrongness 指“过强、过于强烈”的状态或性质。

definition.en: The quality of being too strong or too intense (for example, in taste, smell, effect, or expression).
definition.zh: 过于强烈、过强的性质（例如味道、气味、作用或表达力度太强）。

examples.en: The overstrongness of the perfume gave me a headache.
examples.zh: 这款香水气味过强，让我头疼。

examples.en: Some people dislike the overstrongness of black coffee.
examples.zh: 有些人不喜欢黑咖啡味道过浓。

examples.en: The essay’s overstrongness made the argument feel biased rather than persuasive.
examples.zh: 这篇文章的语气过于强硬，让论证显得偏颇而不够有说服力。

extraExplanation: 这个词由 over-（过度）+ strong（强）+ -ness（名词后缀）组成，字面意思就是“过强的状态”。在实际英文里比较少见，更常用的表达包括: too strong, overpowering, excessive strength/intensity。
常见搭配语境：taste/flavor（味道过重）、smell/scent（气味过冲）、effect（效果太猛）、tone/language（语气或措辞太强硬）。

summary.en: “Overstrove” means “tried too hard” (the past tense of “overstrive”).
summary.zh: “overstrove”表示“过度努力、太拼了”，是“overstrive”的过去式。

definition.en: Past tense of overstrive: to try or compete too hard; to make excessive effort, often causing stress, mistakes, or burnout.
definition.zh: overstrive 的过去式：过度努力；太拼、太用力（常导致压力、失误或耗竭）。

examples.en: She overstrove to please everyone at work and ended up exhausted.
examples.zh: 她在工作中过度努力想让所有人满意，结果筋疲力尽。

examples.en: We overstrove for perfection, and the project took twice as long as planned.
examples.zh: 我们为了完美过度用力，项目花的时间比计划多了一倍。

examples.en: In the interview, he overstrove to sound confident and came across as unnatural.
examples.zh: 面试时他过度努力想显得自信，反而显得不自然。

extraExplanation: “overstrove”很少见，多用于文学化或较正式的语境。日常英语里更常说：“tried too hard / pushed too hard / overdid it”。
注意不要和“strove”（strive 的过去式）混淆；“overstrove”可以理解为“strove too much（太拼了）”。

summary.en: Overstruck describes something hit or impressed twice—commonly coins or printed text showing a second strike.
summary.zh: Overstruck 指被再次击打或压印的（常见于硬币或印刷品），因此会出现重影或叠印。

definition.en: Hit or struck more than once; especially used for a coin, medal, or printed text that received an extra strike or impression.
definition.zh: 被击打（敲击）多次的；尤指硬币、奖章或印刷文字被再次冲压/压印而产生的重影。

examples.en: The collector noticed the coin was overstruck, so the date looked doubled.
examples.zh: 收藏家注意到这枚硬币是二次冲压（overstruck），所以年份看起来像重影。

examples.en: The title appears overstruck, making the letters look darker and slightly blurred.
examples.zh: 标题看起来像被重复压印，字母更黑而且有点模糊。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of overstrike: to strike again or to strike one design over another (as in minting or printing).
definition.zh: overstrike 的过去式/过去分词：再次敲击；或在铸币/印刷中把一个图案压在另一个图案之上。

examples.en: The mint overstruck the old coins with a new design during the reform.
examples.zh: 改革期间，造币厂在旧硬币上二次冲压了新图案。

examples.en: The error happened because the sheet was overstruck during printing.
examples.zh: 这个错误是因为纸张在印刷过程中被重复压印了。

extraExplanation: 在钱币学（coin collecting）里，overstruck 常指“在旧币/旧模具图案上再压一次新图案”，会出现残留文字、双影或错位等特征。与 double-struck（同一枚币被同一模具打了两次）相关，但严格说法不完全相同：overstrike 更强调“压在已有图案之上”。
在打字与排版中，overstrike/overstruck 也可指“在同一位置重复敲击字符”（例如老式打字机用退格再敲一次来加粗或加上符号）。现代电脑里有时叫 overtype（覆盖模式）。

summary.en: Overstrung describes someone who is overly tense or sensitive, and can also describe an instrument strung too tightly.
summary.zh: overstrung 指人过度紧张、敏感，也可指乐器弦拉得过紧。

definition.en: Too nervous, sensitive, or tense; easily upset or stressed.
definition.zh: 过度紧张的；神经高度绷紧的；过于敏感、容易受刺激的。

examples.en: She’s been feeling overstrung since the exams started.
examples.zh: 自从考试开始，她就一直觉得神经很紧绷。

examples.en: Don’t take it personally—he’s a bit overstrung today.
examples.zh: 别往心里去——他今天有点过度紧张。

definition.en: (Of a musical instrument) strung too tightly, producing an unnaturally high or tense sound.
definition.zh: （指乐器）弦上得过紧的，导致音色过尖或过紧张的。

examples.en: The violin sounded harsh, as if it were overstrung.
examples.zh: 小提琴听起来很刺耳，像是弦上得太紧了。

extraExplanation: overstrung 常用于描写人的心理状态，语气比 nervous 更强一点，带有“绷到快断了”的感觉；在写作里也常与 "high-strung"（神经质、易紧张的）意思相近。
词源上可以理解为 over-（过度）+ strung（string 的过去分词，“拉紧、绷紧”）。因此既能字面指“弦绷太紧”，也能引申指“神经绷太紧”。

summary.en: “Overstud” is a nonstandard short form meaning to study too much; standard forms are “overstudy/overstudied.”
summary.zh: “overstud”多为非标准简写，表示学习过度；更标准的形式是“overstudy/overstudied”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Short/informal form of “overstudy”: to study too much or for too long, often causing fatigue, stress, or worse results.
definition.zh: （非标准用法）“overstudy”的简写/口语写法：学习过度或学习时间太长，常导致疲劳、压力增大或效果变差。

examples.en: I overstud for exams and end up making careless mistakes.
examples.zh: 我考试前总是学习过度，结果反而会犯粗心的错误。

examples.en: Try not to overstud—sleep helps memory, too.
examples.zh: 尽量别学习过度——睡眠也能帮助记忆。

definition.en: (Rare) To study something so much that it becomes overly familiar, repetitive, or less interesting.
definition.zh: （较少见）对某事物研究/练习过多，以至于变得太熟、显得重复或失去新鲜感。

examples.en: That topic feels overstud to me now; I want to explore something new.
examples.zh: 那个话题我现在觉得已经研究过头了；我想探索点新的。

extraExplanation: “overstud”在标准英语里不常见，更常用的是“overstudy”（动词）或“overstudied”（形容词，如：an overstudied joke＝被讲到烂的笑话）。如果你是在写作或考试中，建议用更标准的拼写。

summary.en: Overstudied means you studied too much and feel mentally tired or stressed; it can also be the past form of “overstudy.”
summary.zh: Overstudied 指学习过度、导致疲惫或压力过大；也可作 overstudy 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: having studied too much; tired, stressed, or mentally worn out from excessive studying
definition.zh: 用功过度的；因学习过量而疲惫、压力大或精神透支的

examples.en: I felt overstudied and couldn’t focus on the practice test anymore.
examples.zh: 我学习过度，已经没法再专注于模拟测试了。

examples.en: She looked overstudied after staying up late for three nights in a row.
examples.zh: 她连续三晚熬夜后看起来学习过度、很疲惫。

examples.en: If you’re overstudied, a short break can actually improve your memory.
examples.zh: 如果你学习过度，短暂休息反而可能提升记忆效果。

definition.en: past tense or past participle of “overstudy”: to study too much
definition.zh: “overstudy”的过去式/过去分词：学习过度

examples.en: He overstudied the night before and felt sick during the exam.
examples.zh: 他考前一晚学习过度，考试时感觉不舒服。

examples.en: I had overstudied, so my mind went blank during the presentation.
examples.zh: 我学习过度，所以上台展示时脑子一片空白。

extraExplanation: “over-”这个前缀常表示“过度/超过正常程度”（如 overwork 过度工作、overthink 想太多）。在学习语境里，overstudied 强调“多到影响状态与效率”，并不等于“很努力”（hard-working）。
口语里更常见的表达还有：burned out（精疲力竭/倦怠）、studied too much（学太多）、overprepared（准备过头，语气更中性）。

summary.en: Overly focused on studying, sometimes to an excessive or socially awkward degree.
summary.zh: 过于专注学习、用功到有点过头（甚至显得不够放松/不够社交）。

definition.en: Too focused on studying or academic work, often in a way that seems excessive, unbalanced, or not very socially relaxed.
definition.zh: 过于用功的；过分专注于学习或学业的（常带“有点过头、不够放松/不够社交”的语气）。

examples.en: He’s smart, but sometimes he comes across as overstudious and tense.
examples.zh: 他很聪明，但有时给人的感觉太过用功、而且有点紧绷。

examples.en: The novel portrays her as an overstudious student who struggles to make friends.
examples.zh: 小说把她写成一个过于用功、却不太会交朋友的学生。

extraExplanation: “over-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“过度、超过正常/合适的程度”（如 overwork 过劳，overthink 想太多）。因此 overstudious 往往带有轻微负面评价：不是说“勤奋”不好，而是暗示“太过头，缺乏平衡”。
这个词不算非常常用；日常口语里更常见的说法有：too studious / overly studious / bookish / a bit of a nerd（语气更口语，也可能更敏感，使用时注意场合）。

summary.en: “Overstudiously” means doing or saying something in an overly serious, careful, or academic way—more than the situation requires.
summary.zh: “overstudiously”表示以过于认真、谨慎或学术化的方式做事/说话，认真到超过情境所需。

definition.en: In a way that is too serious, careful, or academic; with more effort and formality than the situation needs.
definition.zh: 过于用功地；过于认真（或学究气）地；以不必要的严谨和正式方式。

examples.en: He answered the simple question overstudiously, giving a long explanation full of technical terms.
examples.zh: 一个简单的问题他却回答得过于认真，给了很长的解释，还塞满了专业术语。

examples.en: Her overstudiously polite tone made the conversation feel stiff.
examples.zh: 她那种过分客气的语气让对话显得很僵硬。

examples.en: The report was written overstudiously, as if it were an academic paper instead of a short update.
examples.zh: 这份报告写得过于学术化，好像不是简短的进度更新，而是一篇论文。

extraExplanation: “overstudiously”通常带有轻微负面评价：不是单纯“努力”，而是“用力过猛”，让人感觉拘谨、做作或不够自然。
词形拆解：over-（过度）+ studious（用功的/好学的）+ -ly（副词）。常用来修饰说话方式、写作风格、礼貌程度或处理事情的态度。
语体上较正式、偏书面；日常口语里更常用“too seriously / too formally / trying too hard”来表达相近意思。

summary.en: Overstudiousness means being too focused on studying—hardworking, but to an excessive or unhealthy degree.
summary.zh: overstudiousness 指“过度用功”——努力学习，但程度过头，可能不健康或影响生活平衡。

definition.en: The quality of being too focused on studying or academic work, often to the point of seeming overly serious, socially awkward, or unbalanced.
definition.zh: 过度用功（过分专注于学习或学术任务，以至于显得太严肃、社交笨拙或失去平衡）。

examples.en: His overstudiousness made it hard for him to relax and enjoy weekends.
examples.zh: 他过度用功，导致周末很难放松和享受生活。

examples.en: Some classmates teased her for her overstudiousness, even though she was simply hardworking.
examples.zh: 尽管她只是很努力，同学们还是因为她过度用功而取笑她。

examples.en: The counselor warned that overstudiousness can lead to stress and burnout.
examples.zh: 辅导老师提醒说，过度用功可能会导致压力和倦怠。

extraExplanation: “overstudiousness”由 over-（过度）+ studious（好学的/用功的）+ -ness（把形容词变成名词，表示“……的状态/性质”）组成。它常带一点评价色彩：不是在夸“努力”，而是在说“努力得过头了”，可能影响健康、社交或生活平衡。
语境上常见于学校、职场或心理健康讨论中，强调“用功与平衡”的关系。更中性或正面的表达可用 “diligence / hardworking nature（勤奋）”，更强烈的负面表达可用 “workaholism（工作/学习成瘾）”。

summary.en: “Overstudy” means studying too much or too long, often causing fatigue or stress.
summary.zh: “overstudy”表示学习过度、学太久，常带来疲劳或压力。

definition.en: to study too much or for too long, often causing tiredness, stress, or worse performance
definition.zh: 过度学习；用功过头（常导致疲劳、压力或表现变差）

examples.en: I overstudied the night before the exam and couldn’t focus the next morning.
examples.zh: 我考试前一晚学过头了，第二天早上反而无法集中注意力。

examples.en: If you overstudy, you may remember less because your brain needs rest.
examples.zh: 如果你过度学习，可能反而记得更少，因为大脑需要休息。

examples.en: She tries not to overstudy by taking short breaks every hour.
examples.zh: 她尽量不让自己学过头，每小时都会休息一下。

extraExplanation: “over-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“过度、超过正常范围”。所以 overstudy = study（学习）+ over-（过度）。类似的词还有 overwork（过度工作）、overthink（想太多）。
在日常表达中，人们更常说 “study too much / study for too long”。“overstudy”能用，但相对更书面或较少见。

summary.en: Overstudying means studying too much or too long, often causing fatigue, stress, or worse performance.
summary.zh: Overstudying 指过度学习：学得太久或太拼，常带来疲劳、压力或效果变差。

definition.en: the act of studying too much or for too long, often causing tiredness, stress, or worse learning results
definition.zh: 过度学习；学习时间过长或用力过猛，常导致疲劳、压力，甚至学习效果变差

examples.en: Overstudying can make you feel exhausted and forget what you just reviewed.
examples.zh: 过度学习会让你筋疲力尽，甚至忘掉刚复习的内容。

examples.en: She realized that overstudying the night before the exam made her more anxious.
examples.zh: 她发现考试前一晚过度学习反而让自己更焦虑。

examples.en: To avoid overstudying, he takes short breaks every 30 minutes.
examples.zh: 为了避免过度学习，他每30分钟就休息一下。

definition.en: studying too much or too intensely
definition.zh: （正在）过度学习；学得太久或太拼

examples.en: I’ve been overstudying lately, so I’m trying to sleep earlier.
examples.zh: 我最近一直在过度学习，所以我想早点睡。

examples.en: If you’re overstudying, your focus may drop and small mistakes increase.
examples.zh: 如果你在过度学习，注意力可能下降，小错误会变多。

extraExplanation: “Overstudying”由 over-（过度）+ studying 组成，常用于学习建议、心理健康与效率讨论中，强调“学太多反而适得其反”，容易导致 burnout（倦怠）、焦虑或睡眠不足。
更自然的表达有时会用：study too much / overdo it / cram too hard（尤其指临时抱佛脚式猛学）。

summary.en: Overstuff means to fill something too full, or (for furniture) to add lots of padding.
summary.zh: overstuff 指把东西塞得太满；也可指（家具）加很多填充物使其厚实柔软。

definition.en: to fill something with too much material or too many things, so it becomes too full, tight, or uncomfortable
definition.zh: 把……塞得太满；过度填充（导致太挤、太撑或不舒服）

examples.en: Don’t overstuff the suitcase, or the zipper will break.
examples.zh: 别把行李箱塞得太满，不然拉链会坏。

examples.en: I overstuffed my backpack with books, and now it’s hard to close.
examples.zh: 我把书包塞了太多书，现在很难拉上。

examples.en: The restaurant overstuffs its burritos, so they’re messy to eat.
examples.zh: 那家餐厅把墨西哥卷饼塞得太满，所以吃起来很容易弄得到处都是。

definition.en: (furniture) to put in a lot of padding to make something soft, thick, and plush
definition.zh: （家具）加很多填充物，使其柔软厚实（很“蓬松”）

examples.en: They overstuffed the cushions to make the sofa feel extra soft.
examples.zh: 他们把坐垫填得很厚，让沙发摸起来特别软。

examples.en: This chair was overstuffed for comfort, but it looks bulky.
examples.zh: 这把椅子填充得很厚很舒服，但看起来有点笨重。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、太多”。所以 overstuff 直观地就是“stuff（塞/填充）得过头”。
在日常生活里你更常见到形容词 overstuffed（塞得太满的/填充很厚的），尤其用来形容行李、三明治/卷饼或“厚厚的沙发坐垫”。

summary.en: Overstuffed means filled too full (with things, food, or stuffing), often to an uncomfortable degree.
summary.zh: overstuffed 指“塞得太满/填充过多”，通常到让人不舒服的程度（东西、食物或填充物都可用）。

definition.en: Filled too full; packed so tightly that it looks or feels swollen or uncomfortable.
definition.zh: 塞得太满的；过度填充的；鼓胀或让人不舒服的。

examples.en: The suitcase was overstuffed, so the zipper wouldn’t close.
examples.zh: 行李箱塞得太满了，所以拉链拉不上。

examples.en: After the buffet, I felt overstuffed and needed a walk.
examples.zh: 自助餐后我觉得吃得太撑了，需要去走走。

definition.en: Filled with too much stuffing (soft material) inside, such as a pillow, cushion, or toy.
definition.zh: （枕头、靠垫、玩具等）填充物塞得过多的。

examples.en: This pillow is overstuffed and makes my neck hurt.
examples.zh: 这个枕头填得太多了，让我脖子不舒服。

examples.en: He hugged the overstuffed armchair and sank into it.
examples.zh: 他抱着那张厚实的软扶手椅，整个人陷了进去。

extraExplanation: overstuffed = over-（过度）+ stuffed（塞满的/填充的）。常见搭配：overstuffed suitcase（塞爆的行李箱）、overstuffed backpack（塞太满的背包）、overstuffed armchair（厚实的软扶手椅）。
在家具语境里，overstuffed 常带有“很软、很厚、很蓬松”的感觉，可能偏中性或正面；但在吃饭或收纳语境里，通常偏负面，表示“太撑/太满”。
文学和日常描写中，overstuffed armchair 常用来营造“舒适、旧式、温暖”的画面感（例如客厅里那种又大又软的椅子）。

summary.en: Oversublime means “too sublime”—so lofty or grand that it feels exaggerated or unrealistic.
summary.zh: oversublime 指“过于崇高/宏伟”，高得过头而显得夸张或不真实。

definition.en: excessively lofty, grand, or “sublime” in a way that feels overdone or unreal; too high-flown.
definition.zh: 过于崇高/宏伟（以至于显得夸张、不真实或过头）；过于高调华丽。

examples.en: Some readers found the poem oversublime, full of grand ideas but short on everyday feeling.
examples.zh: 一些读者觉得这首诗过于“崇高”，宏大理念很多，但缺少日常情感。

examples.en: The speech sounded oversublime, as if it aimed to inspire but ended up feeling exaggerated.
examples.zh: 这场演讲听起来过于崇高，像是想鼓舞人心，却反而显得夸张。

extraExplanation: “oversublime”由前缀 over-（过度、过分）+ sublime（崇高的、壮丽的）构成。它不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是 “too lofty / overly grand / excessively sublime”。
在文学评论里，它常带一点批评意味：并非否认作品有高度，而是说它“高得过头”，与现实经验或细节脱节。

summary.en: Oversubscribe means to take or sell more orders/allocations than what is actually available—commonly for tickets or shares, and also for computing resources.
summary.zh: Oversubscribe 指“超额订购/超额认购/超额分配”，即接受或分配的数量超过实际可用数量；常用于票务、股票发行，也用于计算资源。

definition.en: to accept or sell more orders, tickets, or shares than are actually available (often by mistake or by planning to cover the excess later)
definition.zh: （票、名额、股票等）超额接受/超额出售，超过实际可供数量（常因失误或计划之后再补足）

examples.en: The airline oversubscribed the flight, so some passengers were offered vouchers to take a later one.
examples.zh: 航空公司把这趟航班超额售票了，所以一些乘客被提供代金券改乘下一班。

examples.en: The concert was oversubscribed within minutes, and many fans couldn’t get seats.
examples.zh: 演唱会几分钟内就被超额抢订，很多歌迷没能买到座位。

examples.en: The IPO was oversubscribed, meaning investors requested more shares than the company planned to sell.
examples.zh: 这次IPO被超额认购，意思是投资者想买的股票数量超过了公司计划出售的数量。

definition.en: (computing/telecom) to allocate or promise more capacity (CPU, bandwidth, seats, etc.) than a system can reliably provide at the same time; to overcommit resources
definition.zh: （计算机/通信）超额分配/超额承诺资源（如CPU、带宽、席位等），使承诺量超过系统可同时稳定提供的能力；过度承诺资源

examples.en: If you oversubscribe the server, performance may drop during peak hours.
examples.zh: 如果你把服务器资源超额分配，高峰期性能可能会下降。

examples.en: Some cloud plans oversubscribe CPU because not all users run heavy workloads at the same time.
examples.zh: 一些云服务会超额分配CPU，因为并不是所有用户都会同时运行高负载任务。

definition.en: to sign up for more activities, classes, or commitments than you can handle (common in everyday speech, though less formal)
definition.zh: （日常用法）报名/答应太多事情而忙不过来；把自己安排得过满（较口语、较不正式）

examples.en: I oversubscribed this semester and barely have any free time.
examples.zh: 我这学期选得太多了，几乎没有空闲时间。

examples.en: Don’t oversubscribe—leave room in your schedule for rest.
examples.zh: 别把自己安排得太满——给休息留点时间。

extraExplanation: 在商业语境里，oversubscribe 常用于“IPO/发行超额认购”（investors requested more shares than available）。在旅游与交通里，它接近 overbook（航班/酒店超卖），但 oversubscribe 更强调“订购/认购量超过供应量”这一结果。
在云计算/虚拟化里，oversubscribe 常见于资源规划：比如一台物理机有 32 核，但向虚拟机“分配/承诺”合计 64 核，这就叫 CPU oversubscription；是否合理取决于用户是否会同时满负载。

summary.en: Oversubscribed means demand is greater than what’s available (for places, tickets, or shares).
summary.zh: Oversubscribed 指需求（报名/认购）超过可供数量，常用于名额不足或金融“超额认购”。

definition.en: Having more people wanting or signing up than the number of places, tickets, or resources available.
definition.zh: （名额/票/资源）供不应求的；报名或申请人数超过可提供数量的。

examples.en: The workshop is oversubscribed, so we’re adding a second session.
examples.zh: 这场工作坊报名人数超额，所以我们会加开第二场。

examples.en: The city’s after-school program is oversubscribed every year.
examples.zh: 这座城市的课后项目每年都供不应求。

definition.en: (Finance) Describing an investment offer (like an IPO) that receives more orders than the number of shares available.
definition.zh: （金融）超额认购的；（如IPO）认购申请量超过可发行的股票数量。

examples.en: The IPO was heavily oversubscribed on the first day of trading.
examples.zh: 这次IPO在第一天就出现了大量超额认购。

examples.en: Because the bond issue was oversubscribed, the allocation was reduced for small investors.
examples.zh: 由于债券发行超额认购，小投资者的配售份额被降低了。

extraExplanation: “oversubscribed”常见于两类场景：一是活动/课程/服务名额不够（如报名人数超过座位数）；二是金融语境（IPO、债券发行）中“认购超额”，通常会出现“配售/分配（allocation）”按比例缩减。
词形上它是动词“oversubscribe”（超额报名/超额认购）的过去分词/形容词用法，强调“超过可供数量”这一结果。

summary.en: An oversubscriber is someone who subscribes or applies for more than the available amount or allowed limit.
summary.zh: oversubscriber 指订购/认购/报名数量超过可供数量或规定上限的人或机构。

definition.en: A person or organization that subscribes to something in excess of a limit or available supply (for example, requesting more shares, seats, or service capacity than is available).
definition.zh: （个人或机构）超额订购者；超量订阅者（指订购/认购数量超过限额或可供数量，例如股票、座位或服务容量）。

examples.en: In the IPO, many oversubscribers asked for more shares than the company could allocate.
examples.zh: 在首次公开募股（IPO）中，许多超额认购者申请的股票数量超过了公司能分配的数量。

examples.en: Because the event was oversubscribed, oversubscribers were placed on a waiting list.
examples.zh: 由于活动超额报名，超额订阅者被安排到候补名单上。

extraExplanation: “oversubscriber”来自动词“oversubscribe”（超额认购/超额报名/超额订阅）。常见于金融（IPO、债券发行、配售）和活动报名/会员名额等场景。
在商业和网络/电信领域也会出现“oversubscription”（超配/超额订阅）一词，指资源（带宽、服务器、座位等）被按高于实际容量的比例售卖或分配；此时“oversubscriber”可指占用这些超配名额的客户/用户。

summary.en: “Oversubscribes” means demand or sign-ups exceed what’s available, or resources are allocated beyond actual capacity.
summary.zh: “oversubscribes”表示需求/报名超过供给（超额认购/超额报名），或把资源分配得超过实际容量（超额分配）。

definition.en: to sign up for or request more of something (like shares, tickets, or seats) than is available
definition.zh: （对股票、门票、名额等）认购/报名超过可供数量；超额认购/超额订购

examples.en: The IPO oversubscribes when investors apply for far more shares than the company is selling.
examples.zh: 当投资者申请的股票数量远超公司发行数量时，这次IPO就会出现超额认购。

examples.en: The summer camp oversubscribes every year, so many families end up on a waiting list.
examples.zh: 这个夏令营每年都超额报名，所以很多家庭最后只能排队等候。

definition.en: to allocate more resources than you actually have (especially in computing, e.g., servers or cloud capacity), assuming not everyone will need the maximum at the same time
definition.zh: （尤用于计算机/云资源）超额分配；把资源分配得超过实际拥有量（假设不会同时满负荷使用）

examples.en: The provider oversubscribes its servers to keep costs down, but performance can drop at peak times.
examples.zh: 服务商为了降低成本会超额分配服务器资源，但在高峰期性能可能下降。

examples.en: If you oversubscribe your team, deadlines may slip because people are stretched too thin.
examples.zh: 如果你把团队的工作安排得超负荷，截止日期可能会拖延，因为大家会被压得太紧。

extraExplanation: “oversubscribes”是动词“oversubscribe”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it oversubscribes）。常见搭配有：an issue/IPO is oversubscribed（发行/IPO被超额认购）；oversubscribe seats/tickets/capacity（名额/门票/容量超额分配）。在商业新闻里常与“undersubscribed（认购不足）”对比使用。

summary.en: Oversubscribing means demand or commitments exceed what is available or manageable (often in IPOs, tickets, or scheduling).
summary.zh: Oversubscribing 指需求/申购或个人承诺超过可提供或可承受的数量（常见于IPO、门票或时间安排）。

definition.en: (finance/business) Accepting or requesting more orders, applications, or money than the available amount (for example, more investors than shares, or more buyers than tickets).
definition.zh: （金融/商业）接受或征集的订单、申请或资金超过可提供的数量（例如申购股票人数超过可分配的股份，或售票超出座位数）。

examples.en: The IPO ended up oversubscribing, so many investors received fewer shares than they requested.
examples.zh: 这次首次公开募股（IPO）出现超额认购，所以很多投资者拿到的股份比他们申请的要少。

examples.en: The concert sold out within minutes and kept oversubscribing because demand was far higher than supply.
examples.zh: 演唱会几分钟就售罄了，之后还出现超额订购，因为需求远高于供给。

definition.en: (general) Signing up for or committing to too many things, so you cannot realistically handle them all.
definition.zh: （一般）报名/承诺做太多事情，导致自己难以合理完成或应付。

examples.en: I’m oversubscribing this semester—I joined three clubs and took five classes.
examples.zh: 我这学期安排得太满了——参加了三个社团，还选了五门课。

examples.en: If you keep oversubscribing, you’ll burn out quickly.
examples.zh: 如果你一直把自己排得太满，很快就会精疲力竭。

extraExplanation: “oversubscribe”常见于金融新闻：比如IPO“超额认购”表示投资需求超过发行量，通常会触发“配售/按比例分配（allocation / pro rata）”，所以申请的人不一定能拿到想要的数量。
在票务、酒店、航班等场景也会用到：公司可能会“超额预订（overbook）”或出现“超额订购（oversubscribe）”，两者都与供给不足有关，但overbook更强调企业策略性多卖以防爽约。

summary.en: Oversubscription means demand exceeds available supply or capacity; in finance, it means an IPO/new issue is requested for more shares than are offered.
summary.zh: Oversubscription 指需求超过供给或容量；在金融中指IPO/增发时申购数量超过发行量的“超额认购”。

definition.en: a situation where demand is greater than the available supply, places, or capacity (often used for events, services, or resources)
definition.zh: （需求）超过可提供的数量、名额或容量的情况（常用于活动、服务或资源）

examples.en: The university had an oversubscription of 300 applicants for the program.
examples.zh: 这所大学的该项目申请人数超出名额300人。

examples.en: Because of oversubscription, some customers were put on a waiting list.
examples.zh: 由于超额订购，一些顾客被列入了等候名单。

definition.en: in finance, a condition where investors request more shares than are offered in an IPO or new share issue
definition.zh: （金融）在IPO或增发中，投资者申购的股票数量超过发行量的情况

examples.en: The IPO showed strong demand and ended up with heavy oversubscription.
examples.zh: 这次IPO需求强劲，最终出现了大幅超额认购。

examples.en: Oversubscription can lead to share allocations being reduced for individual investors.
examples.zh: 超额认购可能导致个人投资者获配的股份减少。

extraExplanation:
“oversubscription”常见于两类语境：
1）日常/机构管理：名额不够（课程、航班、会员、活动门票等）；
2）资本市场：新股发行（IPO）或增发时“认购”远超“发行量”。在金融新闻里，它通常被解读为市场需求强、热度高，但也意味着投资者可能只能“按比例分配”拿到一部分想买的份额。

summary.en: “Oversubtile” isn’t standard; it likely means “oversubtle”: too subtle to be easily understood or noticed.
summary.zh: “oversubtile”不是标准拼写；很可能想写“oversubtle”，意思是“过于含蓄/过于微妙，以至于不容易被理解或察觉”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard; likely a misspelling of “oversubtle”.) “Oversubtle” describes something that is too subtle—so indirect, nuanced, or understated that people may miss the point.
definition.zh: （非标准拼写；很可能是“oversubtle”的误拼。）“Oversubtle”指“过于含蓄/过于微妙”——表达太委婉、太细腻或太不明显，以至于别人抓不住重点。

examples.en: The hint was oversubtle, so no one realized she was asking for help.
examples.zh: 那个暗示太含蓄了，所以没人意识到她是在求助。

examples.en: His oversubtle humor confused the audience instead of making them laugh.
examples.zh: 他过于微妙的幽默反而让观众困惑，没有笑出来。

extraExplanation: “oversubtile”在英语里不算常见或标准拼写；最可能是把“oversubtle”（过于含蓄/过于微妙）拼错了。
“subtle”常见发音里中间的 b 不发音（/ˈsʌtəl/），这也容易导致拼写混淆。

summary.en: “Oversubtle” means ‘too subtle,’ making the meaning easy to miss.
summary.zh: “oversubtle”表示“过于微妙/含蓄”，以至于意思容易被忽略或看不懂。

definition.en: too subtle; so indirect, delicate, or nuanced that it becomes hard to notice or understand
definition.zh: 过于含蓄/微妙的；因为太间接、太细腻而让人难以察觉或理解

examples.en: The hint was oversubtle, so no one realized she wanted help.
examples.zh: 这个暗示太过含蓄了，所以没人意识到她需要帮助。

examples.en: His oversubtle humor went over my head until someone explained the joke.
examples.zh: 他的幽默太过微妙，我一开始没听懂，直到有人解释这个笑点。

examples.en: The director’s message felt oversubtle for a general audience.
examples.zh: 对普通观众来说，导演想表达的主题显得过于微妙。

extraExplanation: “over-”表示“过度、太……”。“subtle”本来是褒义，表示细腻、含蓄、有层次；加上“over-”后常带轻微贬义，意思是“微妙到过头，反而不清楚/不易被理解”。
“oversubtle”不是非常常见的日常词，更常见的替代说法有：“too subtle”、“so subtle that…”。在写作或评论（影评、艺术评论、文学评论）中更容易见到。

summary.en: Oversubtleties = excessive subtle distinctions that overcomplicate communication or reasoning.
summary.zh: oversubtleties 指“过多的微妙细节/过度细分”，使表达或推理变得复杂甚至难懂。

definition.en: (Rare) Too many or excessive subtle distinctions or fine points, especially in speaking, writing, or argument; over-refinement that can make something unclear or overcomplicated.
definition.zh: （罕见用法）过多的细微区别/微妙之处，尤指在表达、写作或论证中过度追求“细节上的精妙”，反而让内容变得不清楚或过于复杂。

examples.en: The essay is smart, but its oversubtleties make the main point hard to follow.
examples.zh: 这篇文章很聪明，但过多的细微讲究让主旨变得难以把握。

examples.en: In negotiations, oversubtleties can confuse everyone and slow decisions.
examples.zh: 在谈判中，过度的细枝末节可能让所有人困惑并拖慢决策。

extraExplanation: “oversubtleties”不是常见词，更像是把前缀 over-（过度）加在 subtlety（微妙、细微差别）上形成的临时造词，用来强调“细节讲得太细、太绕”。更自然的表达常用：too many subtleties / excessive subtlety / overthinking the details / splitting hairs（吹毛求疵）。
拼写提示：subtle 的 b 不发音；subtlety 的重音在第一个音节（SUB-tle-ty）。

summary.en: Oversubtlety means being so subtle that your point becomes unclear.
summary.zh: Oversubtlety 指“过度含蓄/过度微妙”，以至于表达重点变得不清楚。

definition.en: the quality of being too subtle or indirect, so that the meaning becomes hard to notice or understand
definition.zh: 过度含蓄/过度微妙：表达太隐晦或太绕，以至于意思不容易被察觉或理解

examples.en: The film’s message got lost in its oversubtlety.
examples.zh: 这部电影的信息被它的过度含蓄给淹没了。

examples.en: In a job interview, oversubtlety can make your answers sound evasive.
examples.zh: 在面试里，过度含蓄会让你的回答听起来像在回避问题。

extraExplanation: “oversubtlety”不是特别常见的拼写，写作中更常见的是带连字符的“over-subtlety”，或用更自然的表达如“being too subtle / overly subtle communication”。
它通常带有负面含义：不是赞美“有分寸”，而是强调“太隐晦导致沟通失败”。在学术评论、影评、文学评论里更可能出现。

summary.en: “oversubtly” is a rare/nonstandard form meaning “too subtly”; use “too subtly” or “overly subtly” in most cases.
summary.zh: “oversubtly”较少见且不太规范，意思是“过于含蓄地/微妙地”；通常建议用“too subtly”或“overly subtly”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) In a way that is too subtle; so subtle that people may miss the point. More standard: “too subtly” or “overly subtly.”
definition.zh: （非标准/少见）过于含蓄地、过于微妙地；微妙到让人抓不住重点。更常见的说法是 “too subtly” 或 “overly subtly”。

examples.en: The hint was given oversubtly, so nobody understood it.
examples.zh: 这个暗示给得过于含蓄，所以没人懂。

examples.en: Try not to explain it oversubtly—be a little clearer.
examples.zh: 尽量别讲得过于含蓄——清楚一点。

extraExplanation: “oversubtly”一般被视为拼写/用词不规范的写法，因为英语里更自然的结构是“too + adv.”（too subtly）或“overly + adv.”（overly subtly）。
在正式写作里，建议用：too subtly / overly subtly / in an overly subtle way。

summary.en: Oversuds means to create or have too much soapy foam, especially in a washing machine.
summary.zh: Oversuds 指（尤其在洗衣机清洗时）产生或出现过多的肥皂泡沫。

definition.en: to produce or cause too many suds (foam), especially when washing with soap or detergent
definition.zh: （尤指用肥皂/洗涤剂清洗时）起泡过多；使泡沫过多

examples.en: If you add too much detergent, the washer can oversuds and stop mid-cycle.
examples.zh: 如果洗涤剂加太多，洗衣机可能会起泡过多，清洗到一半就停下来。

examples.en: This soap tends to oversuds in hard water.
examples.zh: 这种肥皂在硬水里容易起泡过多。

definition.en: (of a washer or wash load) to have too many suds
definition.zh: （指洗衣机或衣物清洗过程）泡沫过多

examples.en: The machine oversuds when I use this brand.
examples.zh: 我用这个牌子时，机器就会泡沫过多。

examples.en: It started to oversuds, so I paused the cycle and ran an extra rinse.
examples.zh: 开始泡沫过多了，所以我暂停了程序并加了一次漂洗。

extraExplanation: “oversuds”常见于家电说明书、清洁用品提示或维修语境，尤其是洗衣机：泡沫太多会影响排水、传感器判断，甚至导致溢泡或报警。
构词很直观：over-（过度）+ suds（泡沫）。日常也常用名词短语“too many suds / excess suds”来表达同样意思。

summary.en: Oversufficiency means having more than enough—an unnecessary or problematic excess.
summary.zh: oversufficiency 指“过度充足”，即多到超出需要、甚至可能带来问题的过量。

definition.en: The state of having more than enough of something; an excess that goes beyond what is needed.
definition.zh: 过度充足；超过所需的“太多”，带有“多到没必要/可能造成问题”的意思。

examples.en: The oversufficiency of food at the banquet led to a lot of waste.
examples.zh: 宴会上食物过度充足，结果造成了大量浪费。

examples.en: In some places, water oversufficiency during the rainy season can still cause serious problems like flooding.
examples.zh: 在一些地方，雨季时水资源“过度充足”仍会带来严重问题，比如洪水。

extraExplanation: “oversufficiency”不是特别常见的标准词汇，更常见的表达是“excess / surplus / overabundance / glut”。它由 over-（过度）+ sufficiency（充足）构成，含义直观，但在正式写作中通常会用更地道的同义词来替换。
语气提示：它通常暗示“多到不合适”或“多了反而有负面影响”，而不只是中性的“充足”。

summary.en: Oversufficient means more than enough; greater than what is needed.
summary.zh: oversufficient 表示“过于充足、超过所需”。

definition.en: More than enough; greater than what is needed.
definition.zh: 过于充足的；超出所需的。

examples.en: The budget was oversufficient for the project, so we could add a training program.
examples.zh: 预算对这个项目来说过于充足，所以我们可以加一个培训项目。

examples.en: An oversufficient supply of food can lead to waste if it isn’t stored or shared well.
examples.zh: 食物供应过于充足，如果没有妥善储存或分享，可能会造成浪费。

extraExplanation: “oversufficient”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下母语者更常用“more than enough / more than sufficient / excessive / surplus”来表达同样意思。
构词上是“over-（过度）+ sufficient（足够的）”，语义清晰但偏书面、技术化，常见于较正式或学术式写法里。

summary.en: “Oversufficiently” means “more than sufficiently; excessively.”
summary.zh: “oversufficiently”表示“超过足够、过度地”。

definition.en: to a degree that is more than sufficient; excessively (more than what is needed)
definition.zh: 过分充足地；超出所需地；过度地

examples.en: The pantry was oversufficiently stocked for just two people.
examples.zh: 对只有两个人来说，食品储藏室的储备过分充足。

examples.en: He explained the plan oversufficiently, so the meeting ran long.
examples.zh: 他把计划讲得过于充分，导致会议拖得很长。

examples.en: Don’t worry about being oversufficiently polite—simple kindness is enough.
examples.zh: 别担心要“过度礼貌”，简单的友善就足够了。

extraExplanation: “oversufficiently”由前缀 over-（过度、超过）+ sufficient（足够的）+ -ly（副词后缀）构成，字面意思就是“超过足够地”。
这个词在日常英语中非常少见，常见的替代表达有 “more than sufficiently”“overly”“excessively”“unnecessarily”。在正式写作或想强调“超出所需”时偶尔会用到。

summary.en: “Oversum” is not standard English; it’s usually a typo or a borrowing. In English, use “total/sum/overall total” (or “summary,” depending on context).
summary.zh: “oversum”不是标准英语，多为拼写错误或外来借用。英语中通常用“total/sum/overall total”（或视语境用“summary”）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. In English writing, “oversum” is usually a misspelling or a direct borrowing from another language, so its meaning depends on context.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。在英文中看到“oversum”多半是拼写错误或从其他语言直接借用，因此含义要看上下文。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “oversum” in an English dictionary—could it be a typo for “overall sum” or “summary” in your document?
examples.zh: 我在英语词典里找不到“oversum”——你文件里是不是想写“overall sum（总和）”或“summary（摘要）”？

definition.en: (Rare/technical, influenced by other languages) the overall total; the sum of amounts. In natural English, people usually write “total,” “sum,” or “overall total.”
definition.zh: （罕见/偏技术用法，受其他语言影响）总计；总和。更自然的英语一般写“total / sum / overall total”。

examples.en: Please check the total at the bottom of the invoice (not “oversum”).
examples.zh: 请核对发票底部的总计（一般不写“oversum”）。

examples.en: The report lists subtotals for each group and a final total for the whole project.
examples.zh: 报告列出了每组的小计，以及整个项目的最终总计。

extraExplanation: “oversum”在一些非英语语境里更常见：例如荷兰语/斯堪的纳维亚语里可能指“总计/盈余/概览”。如果你能提供一句原文（包含前后句）或说明它来自哪种语言/哪份文件（发票、报表、论文等），我可以帮你判断最准确的英文表达（如 total, grand total, surplus, summary）。

summary.en: “Oversup” is an informal abbreviation of “oversupply,” meaning supply is greater than demand.
summary.zh: “oversup”是“oversupply（供过于求/供给过剩）”的非正式缩写，表示供给大于需求。

definition.en: An informal abbreviation of “oversupply,” meaning there is more of something (often goods or resources) available than people want or need.
definition.zh: “oversupply（供过于求/供给过剩）”的非正式缩写，指某种商品或资源的供应量超过市场需求。

examples.en: The market is in oversup, so prices are falling fast.
examples.zh: 市场供过于求，所以价格在快速下跌。

examples.en: Oversup of apartments has made rents more competitive in this area.
examples.zh: 公寓供应过剩让这个地区的房租更有竞争力（更容易降价/让利）。

definition.en: A shorthand label (especially in notes, spreadsheets, or trading chat) meaning a situation where supply is excessive compared with demand.
definition.zh: 一种简写标签（常见于笔记、表格或交易/行业聊天），表示“供给相对需求过多”的状态。

examples.en: Status: oversup → reduce production next quarter.
examples.zh: 状态：供给过剩 → 下季度减少产量。

examples.en: Oil: slight oversup; watch inventory data.
examples.zh: 原油：轻微供给过剩；关注库存数据。

extraExplanation: “oversup”不是标准书面英语里的常用词，更常见的完整形式是“oversupply”。在正式写作（报告、论文、对外邮件）里建议写全。
在经济学/商业语境中，oversupply 通常会带来降价、库存上升、促销增加或减产等结果。

summary.en: “Oversuperstitious” means excessively superstitious.
summary.zh: “oversuperstitious”意为“过度迷信的”。

definition.en: Excessively superstitious; having too strong a belief that luck, omens, or supernatural forces control events.
definition.zh: 过度迷信的；非常相信运气、征兆或超自然力量会支配事情的。

examples.en: She’s oversuperstitious—she won’t start a trip on Friday the 13th.
examples.zh: 她太迷信了——在“13号星期五”那天绝不出门旅行。

examples.en: An oversuperstitious fear of bad luck made him avoid walking under ladders.
examples.zh: 由于过度害怕倒霉，他会刻意避开从梯子下面走过去。

examples.en: The coach tried to calm the team’s oversuperstitious rituals before the game.
examples.zh: 教练试着在比赛前让队里那些过度迷信的仪式少一点。

extraExplanation: “over-”是常见前缀，表示“过度、太……”。所以 oversuperstitious = superstitious（迷信的）+ over（过度）。在正式写作中更常见的表达是 “overly superstitious” 或 “excessively superstitious”；“oversuperstitious”较少见，但语义清晰。

summary.en: “Oversuperstitiously” means “in an excessively superstitious way.”
summary.zh: “oversuperstitiously”意为“过度迷信地”。

definition.en: In an overly superstitious way; with more superstition than is reasonable or typical.
definition.zh: 过度迷信地；以不合理或超出一般程度的迷信方式。

examples.en: He avoided traveling on Friday the 13th, almost oversuperstitiously.
examples.zh: 他几乎是过度迷信地避开在“13号星期五”出行。

examples.en: She checked her horoscope every morning, oversuperstitiously basing decisions on it.
examples.zh: 她每天早上都看星座运势，过度迷信地把决定建立在那些内容上。

examples.en: The team treated the lucky charm oversuperstitiously, believing it guaranteed a win.
examples.zh: 队员们对那个幸运物抱着过度迷信的态度，相信它能保证赢。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 over-（“过度、太过”）+ superstitiously 组合而成，强调“比一般的迷信更夸张”。在现代英语里不算常见，更常用的表达是 overly superstitious / superstitiously 或 in an overly superstitious way。
语气上常带轻微批评或调侃：说话者通常认为这种迷信“有点过头”。

summary.en: Oversuperstitiousness means extreme or excessive superstition.
summary.zh: oversuperstitiousness 指“过度迷信/极端迷信”。

definition.en: The quality of being excessively superstitious; an extreme tendency to believe that events are controlled by luck, omens, or supernatural forces.
definition.zh: 过度迷信；极端相信运气、征兆或超自然力量会支配事件的倾向。

examples.en: Her oversuperstitiousness made her avoid traveling on Friday the 13th.
examples.zh: 她的过度迷信让她在“13号星期五”这天避免出行。

examples.en: The story shows how oversuperstitiousness can lead people to fear harmless coincidences.
examples.zh: 这个故事展示了过度迷信如何让人害怕无害的巧合。

examples.en: His oversuperstitiousness caused him to blame every setback on bad luck instead of planning better.
examples.zh: 他的过度迷信让他把每次挫折都怪在坏运气上，而不是更好地规划。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多用于说明“迷信到过头”的状态。更常见、更自然的表达是：extreme superstition（极端迷信）或 being overly superstitious（过于迷信）。
构词上可以拆开理解：over-（过度）+ superstitious（迷信的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“性质/状态”）。

summary.en: “Oversupped” means having eaten too much supper (a literary/old-fashioned word).
summary.zh: “oversupped”指“晚餐吃得过饱”，多为文学或古旧用法。

definition.en: (literary, old-fashioned) Having eaten too much supper; overfed after an evening meal.
definition.zh: （文学/古旧用法）晚餐吃得过多的；吃得过饱（尤指晚餐后）。

examples.en: Oversupped and sleepy, he pushed his chair back from the table.
examples.zh: 晚餐吃得过饱又犯困，他把椅子从桌边往后一推。

examples.en: The oversupped guests lingered by the fire, too full to dance.
examples.zh: 客人们晚餐吃得过饱，便在壁炉旁逗留，饱得不想跳舞。

definition.en: Past form of “oversup”: to eat too much at supper (rare).
definition.zh: “oversup”的过去式/过去分词：晚餐吃得太多（罕见）。

examples.en: He oversupped and regretted it on the long walk home.
examples.zh: 他晚餐吃得太多，回家走长路时就后悔了。

extraExplanation: “sup”是较古老的动词，意思是“吃晚饭/进晚餐”，在现代英语中更常用“have dinner/supper”。因此“oversupped”多出现在文学描写或带复古语气的句子里。

summary.en: “Oversupping” means eating/drinking too much at supper (a rare, old-fashioned word).
summary.zh: “oversupping”指晚餐吃（喝）过量，是个罕见、带古风的用法。

definition.en: eating or drinking too much at supper; having too large an evening meal (present participle of the rare verb “oversup”).
definition.zh: 晚餐吃（喝）得太多；晚饭过量（罕见动词 oversup 的现在分词）。

examples.en: He blamed his stomachache on oversupping the night before.
examples.zh: 他把胃痛归咎于前一晚晚餐吃得太多。

examples.en: After oversupping, she felt too heavy to concentrate on reading.
examples.zh: 晚饭吃太多后，她觉得很撑，没法专心阅读。

examples.en: Try not to make a habit of oversupping during the holidays.
examples.zh: 假期里尽量别养成晚饭吃太多的习惯。

extraExplanation: “oversupping”非常少见，带有古风/文学色彩；现代英语更常用：overeat (at dinner/supper), eat too much, overindulge。
“sup”原义是“小口喝/吃”（如喝汤），也可指“吃晚饭”。因此 oversup 字面意思就是“晚饭吃（喝）过量”。

summary.en: Oversupplied means there is more of something available than is needed or wanted, especially in a market.
summary.zh: oversupplied 指某物（尤其在市场中）供应量超过需求，出现“供过于求”。

definition.en: (of a market or product) having more supply than demand; too much of something is available.
definition.zh: （市场或产品）供过于求的；供应量超过需求量的。

examples.en: The rental market is oversupplied, so prices may fall.
examples.zh: 租房市场供过于求，所以价格可能会下降。

examples.en: The store was oversupplied with winter coats after a warm season.
examples.zh: 因为冬天偏暖，那家店冬季外套进货过多。

examples.en: When a region is oversupplied with labor, wages can stagnate.
examples.zh: 当一个地区劳动力供过于求时，工资可能会停滞不前。

definition.en: provided with more supplies or resources than needed.
definition.zh: （人或系统）配给/供给过量的；得到超过需要的物资或资源的。

examples.en: The team was oversupplied with equipment and had no space to store it.
examples.zh: 团队的设备配发过多，连存放空间都不够。

examples.en: In emergencies, some shelters may be oversupplied with one item but lack others.
examples.zh: 在紧急情况下，有些避难所某种物品可能过多，但其他物资却短缺。

extraExplanation: “oversupplied”常见于经济与商业语境（如oversupplied market）。与之相关的核心概念是“供需关系”：当供给（supply）大于需求（demand）时，往往会带来降价、库存积压、竞争加剧等现象。

summary.en: Oversupplies means an excess amount of goods or supplies, or it can be the verb “oversupplies” meaning “provides too much.”
summary.zh: Oversupplies 指“供给过剩/多余的物资”，也可作动词，表示“过量供应”。

definition.en: More goods, materials, or items than are needed or can be sold/used (an excess supply).
definition.zh: （商品、材料等）供给过剩；多余的供应量。

examples.en: The warehouse is full because of oversupplies from last season.
examples.zh: 仓库堆满了，因为上个季度供给过剩。

examples.en: When there are oversupplies, prices often fall.
examples.zh: 当出现供给过剩时，价格往往会下降。

definition.en: Third-person singular of “oversupply”: to provide more of something than is needed or wanted.
definition.zh: “oversupply”的第三人称单数：过量供应；供给超过需求。

examples.en: The company oversupplies the market, so stores discount the products quickly.
examples.zh: 公司对市场供货过量，所以商店很快就把产品打折处理。

examples.en: If the farm oversupplies eggs, the price can drop sharply.
examples.zh: 如果农场鸡蛋供应过量，价格可能会大幅下跌。

extraExplanation: 在经济学语境里，oversupply 常与 “demand（需求）” 一起出现：oversupply（供给过剩）可能导致 “price drops（降价）”、 “inventory buildup（库存积压）”。日常表达中也常用更简单的说法，如 “too much supply / too many products”。

summary.en: Oversupply means there is more of something available than people need or want; it can also mean to provide too much.
summary.zh: Oversupply 指某物数量超过需求（供过于求）；也可作动词表示“过度供应”。

definition.en: an amount that is more than what is needed or demanded (especially in a market)
definition.zh: （尤指市场中的）供给过剩；供过于求

examples.en: A global oversupply of oil pushed prices down.
examples.zh: 全球石油供给过剩导致价格下跌。

examples.en: There is an oversupply of graduates in some fields.
examples.zh: 在某些领域，毕业生出现了供给过剩。

definition.en: to supply too much of something; to provide more than is needed or can be sold
definition.zh: 过度供应；供给超过需求（或可销售量）

examples.en: Farmers sometimes oversupply the market after a good harvest.
examples.zh: 丰收之后，农民有时会让市场出现供过于求。

examples.en: The company oversupplied stores, and a lot of products went unsold.
examples.zh: 公司给门店供货过多，结果很多产品卖不出去。

extraExplanation: 在经济学语境里，oversupply 常与 demand（需求）对比使用：oversupply 往往会带来降价、库存增加、打折清仓，甚至减产。常见搭配：oversupply of housing/oil/milk（房产/石油/牛奶供给过剩），market oversupply（市场供给过剩）。

summary.en: “Oversupplying” means supplying more than is needed or can be sold/used.
summary.zh: “oversupplying”指供应过多，超过实际需要或市场/使用方能消化的数量。

definition.en: supplying more of something than is needed or can be used/sold (the -ing form of “oversupply”)
definition.zh: 供给过多；供应超过需要或市场能消化的数量（“oversupply”的 -ing 形式）

examples.en: The company is oversupplying the market, so prices are falling.
examples.zh: 这家公司正在向市场过度供给，所以价格在下跌。

examples.en: Oversupplying hospitals with one item can leave shortages elsewhere.
examples.zh: 给医院某一种物资供应过多，可能会导致其他物资短缺。

examples.en: They were accused of oversupplying the store with products that didn’t sell well.
examples.zh: 他们被指责给商店供货过多，而那些产品并不好卖。

definition.en: the act or process of supplying too much (used as a gerund)
definition.zh: 过度供给的行为或过程（作动名词使用）

examples.en: Oversupplying can create waste and increase storage costs.
examples.zh: 过度供给会造成浪费，并增加仓储成本。

examples.en: The policy was meant to prevent oversupplying in the housing market.
examples.zh: 这项政策旨在防止房地产市场的过度供给。

extraExplanation: “oversupplying”常见于商业与经济语境，表示供给超过需求，容易导致“glut（供过于求/过剩）”、降价、库存积压与浪费。也常与“demand（需求）”“inventory（库存）”“capacity（产能）”等词搭配使用。

summary.en: “Oversups” is an informal online abbreviation meaning “oversupply/surplus,” not a standard word in formal English.
summary.zh: “oversups”多为网络非正式缩写，通常指“供过于求/过剩（供应、物资、库存）”，正式英语中不常用。

definition.en: A nonstandard/informal abbreviation (often seen online) for “oversupply” or “surplus supplies.”
definition.zh: 非标准/非正式缩写（多见于网络语境），通常指“供过于求”或“过剩的物资/供应”。

examples.en: The store ordered too much—now we have oversups sitting in the back room.
examples.zh: 店里进货太多了——现在后仓堆着一堆“oversups”（过剩库存）。

examples.en: Because demand dropped, the market ended up with oversups of the product.
examples.zh: 由于需求下降，市场出现了该产品的“oversups”（供过于求/过剩）。

definition.en: (Rare) Used like an adjective meaning “oversupplied” or “having too much supply.”
definition.zh: （较少见）当作形容词用，表示“供应过多的/供过于求的”。

examples.en: This category is oversups right now, so prices are falling.
examples.zh: 这个品类现在是oversups（供应过多），所以价格在下跌。

extraExplanation: “oversups”不是常见的标准英语词条，更像是口语/论坛里的缩写写法。正式写作更建议用 oversupply（供过于求/过剩供应）、surplus（盈余/过剩）或 overstock（库存过剩）。
如果你是在某个特定圈子（例如游戏、公会、交易群、校园）看到它，它也可能是该群体内部的缩写。若你能提供原句，我可以更准确判断它在那里的含义。

summary.en: “Oversure” means overly confident or too certain.
summary.zh: “oversure”表示“过于自信/过于确定”。

definition.en: Too sure of yourself; overly confident (often in a way that seems careless or arrogant).
definition.zh: 过于自信的；自以为是的（常带有轻率或傲慢的意味）。

examples.en: He was oversure about the result and didn’t double-check his work.
examples.zh: 他对结果过于自信，没有再检查一遍。

examples.en: Being oversure can make you ignore helpful advice.
examples.zh: 过于自信会让你忽视有用的建议。

synonyms: self-assured (often neutral, but can feel too strong in context)
extraExplanation: “oversure”在现代英语里比较少见，更常见的写法是“overconfident”或“too sure (of yourself)”。在文学或较老的文体中，你可能会看到“over-sure/over sure”的变体写法。
前缀“over-”常表示“过度、超过正常程度”（如 overreact 反应过度、overestimate 高估）。理解这个前缀有助于猜测类似词的含义。

summary.en: “Oversured” is likely a misspelling of “overassured,” meaning too confident.
summary.zh: “oversured”很可能是“overassured”的拼写错误，意思是“过分自信”。

definition.en: Too confident in a way that may seem proud, pushy, or unaware of risks.
definition.zh: 过分自信的；（显得）自负的、过于笃定而忽视风险的。

examples.en: He sounded overassured in the interview, so the manager asked tougher questions.
examples.zh: 他在面试中听起来过分自信，所以经理问了更难的问题。

examples.en: Don’t be overassured—double-check the numbers before you send the report.
examples.zh: 别太笃定——发送报告前把数据再核对一遍。

extraExplanation: “oversured”不是常见或标准的英文拼写。你可能想写的是 overassured（过分自信的）。也有人会把它误写成 *oversured*，因为发音里有 /ʃʊr/ 的感觉。
近义表达：overconfident（更中性/常用）、too sure of oneself；语气更负面时可用 arrogant（傲慢的）。

summary.en: “Oversurely” means ‘too confidently or too certainly.’
summary.zh: “oversurely”表示“过于自信/过于笃定地”。

definition.en: In an overly confident or overly certain way; more surely than is wise or justified.
definition.zh: 过于自信地；过于笃定地（带有“太肯定了、未免太有把握”的语气）。

examples.en: He spoke oversurely about the results, and later had to correct himself.
examples.zh: 他对结果说得过于笃定，后来不得不改口。

examples.en: Don’t promise oversurely when so much is still uncertain.
examples.zh: 在还有很多不确定因素时，别把话说得过满。

extraExplanation: “oversurely”比较少见，带一点古风或书面色彩，常见于较早期英语或仿古写作中。现代英语里更常用“too confidently / too certainly / overconfidently / with too much certainty”等表达。
前缀“over-”在英语里常表示“过度、太……”，放在“surely（当然地/确定地）”前面，就形成“过分确定”的意思，通常暗示说话者判断失准或不够谨慎。

summary.en: Oversureness means too much certainty or confidence—overconfidence.
summary.zh: oversureness 指过分确信或过度自信。

definition.en: Excessive confidence that you are right or will succeed; too much certainty (overconfidence).
definition.zh: 过度自信；过分确信（觉得自己一定正确或一定会成功）。

examples.en: His oversureness made him ignore helpful advice.
examples.zh: 他的过度自信让他无视了有用的建议。

examples.en: A little confidence helps, but oversureness can lead to careless mistakes.
examples.zh: 一点自信有帮助，但过度自信可能导致粗心的错误。

extraExplanation: “oversureness”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的表达是“overconfidence”“excessive certainty”或“too much confidence”。
构词上可理解为 over-（过度）+ sureness（确信、确定感）。在正式写作中，建议优先使用更常见的“overconfidence”。

summary.en: Oversurety means being too certain or too confident; rarely, it can mean excessive guarantee/security.
summary.zh: oversurety 指“过度确信/过度自信”；少见情况下也可指“过度担保/保障”。

definition.en: excessive confidence or certainty; being too sure about something.
definition.zh: 过度的自信或确信；对某事“太确定”。

examples.en: His oversurety made him ignore the warnings and take unnecessary risks.
examples.zh: 他过度自信，忽视了警告，冒了不必要的风险。

examples.en: Oversurety can prevent you from checking your work carefully.
examples.zh: 过度确信可能会让你不再仔细检查自己的作业。

definition.en: (rare) excessive assurance or guarantee; more security than is needed.
definition.zh: （少见）过度的担保或保障；超过必要程度的安全保证。

examples.en: They demanded oversurety before agreeing to the deal.
examples.zh: 在同意交易前，他们要求过度的担保。

extraExplanation: “oversurety”相当少见，更常用的表达是 overconfidence（过度自信）、certainty（确信）、overassurance（过度保证/安抚）。
词形上由 over-（过度）+ surety（确定/担保）组成。surety 本身既可指“确信”，也可指法律或商业语境中的“担保/保证人”。
在现代英语写作中，用 “overconfidence” 或 “too much certainty” 往往更自然；“oversurety”更像偏古风或较少见的用词。

summary.en: “Oversurge” means to surge excessively or to surge over and overwhelm something.
summary.zh: “Oversurge”指“过度猛增/上涨”，也可指“涌过并淹没、席卷”。

definition.en: to rise, swell, or surge too much; to surge beyond a normal or safe level
definition.zh: （水位、情绪、需求等）过度上涨；猛增到超过正常或安全水平
